requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support [OpenID4VP] for remote presentation flows and [ISO/IEC 18013-5] for proximity presentation flows, to receive and respond to presentation requests for person identification data (PID) and attestations by Relying Parties.
requirements.searchText: oia_01 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support [openid4vp] for remote presentation flows and [iso/iec 18013-5] for proximity presentation flows, to receive and respond to presentation requests for person identification data (pid) and attestations by relying parties.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support proving cryptographic device binding between the WSCA/WSCD or a keystore included in the Wallet Unit and a PID or attestation, in accordance with [SD-JWT VC] or [ISO/IEC 18013-5].
requirements.notes: Such a mechanism is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT VC].
requirements.searchText: oia_02 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support proving cryptographic device binding between the wsca/wscd or a keystore included in the wallet unit and a pid or attestation, in accordance with [sd-jwt vc] or [iso/iec 18013-5]. such a mechanism is called 'mdoc authentication' in [iso/iec 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [sd-jwt vc].

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: oia_03 accessing online services with a wallet unit empty

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the protocol specified in 'OpenID for Verifiable Presentations', see [OpenID4VP], with additions and changes as documented in this Annex and in technical specifications referenced in this Annex.
requirements.searchText: oia_03a accessing online services with a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the protocol specified in 'openid for verifiable presentations', see [openid4vp], with additions and changes as documented in this annex and in technical specifications referenced in this annex.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], Relying Parties and Wallet Units SHALL comply with the requirements in the profile for OpenID4VP specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-7] Annex B.
requirements.searchText: oia_03b accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [iso/iec 18013-5], relying parties and wallet units shall comply with the requirements in the profile for openid4vp specified in [iso/iec 18013-7] annex b.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [SD-JWT VC], Relying Parties and Wallet Units SHALL comply with the requirements in the 'OpenID for Verifiable Presentations for IETF SD-JWT VC' profile specified in [HAIP].
requirements.searchText: oia_03c accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows, when the format of the requested attestation complies with [sd-jwt vc], relying parties and wallet units shall comply with the requirements in the 'openid for verifiable presentations for ietf sd-jwt vc' profile specified in [haip].

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL verify and process PID or attestation presentation requests from Relying Parties in accordance with the protocols and interfaces specified in [OpenID4VP] for remote flows.
requirements.searchText: oia_04 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall verify and process pid or attestation presentation requests from relying parties in accordance with the protocols and interfaces specified in [openid4vp] for remote flows.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: After verifying and processing a PID or attestation request, the Wallet Unit SHALL display to the User the identity of the requesting Relying Party and the requested attributes.
requirements.searchText: oia_05 accessing online services with a wallet unit after verifying and processing a pid or attestation request, the wallet unit shall display to the user the identity of the requesting relying party and the requested attributes.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL present the requested attributes only after having received the User's authorisation.
requirements.notes: See also OIA_07.
requirements.searchText: oia_06 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall present the requested attributes only after having received the user's authorisation. see also oia_07.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support selective disclosure of attributes from PIDs and attestations to be released to the requesting Relying Parties.
requirements.searchText: oia_07 accessing online services with a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support selective disclosure of attributes from pids and attestations to be released to the requesting relying parties.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: Wallet Units and Relying Party Instances SHALL support the [W3C Digital Credentials API]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for remote presentation flows, provided that a) this API is a W3C Recommendation, b) this API complies with the expectations outlined in [Chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3) of the Topic F discussion paper, and c) this API is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.
requirements.searchText: oia_08 accessing online services with a wallet unit wallet units and relying party instances shall support the [w3c digital credentials api]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for remote presentation flows, provided that a) this api is a w3c recommendation, b) this api complies with the expectations outlined in [chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3) of the topic f discussion paper, and c) this api is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: If Wallet Units and Relying Party Instances do not support the [W3C Digital Credentials API], they SHALL implement adequate mitigations for the challenges described in [Section 4.4.3.1](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#4431-introduction) of the ARF main document.
requirements.searchText: oia_08a accessing online services with a wallet unit if wallet units and relying party instances do not support the [w3c digital credentials api], they shall implement adequate mitigations for the challenges described in [section 4.4.3.1](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#4431-introduction) of the arf main document.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL, by default (see OIA_08d), disclose the presence of all stored attestations (mean their attestation type) to the Digital Credentials API framework, but it SHALL NOT disclose the attributes and their values in these attestations.
requirements.notes: The latter restriction applies even if such disclosure would enhance the services provided by the operating system to the Wallet Unit, for example, attestation selection in the context of the Digital Credentials API.
requirements.searchText: oia_08b accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall, by default (see oia_08d), disclose the presence of all stored attestations (mean their attestation type) to the digital credentials api framework, but it shall not disclose the attributes and their values in these attestations. the latter restriction applies even if such disclosure would enhance the services provided by the operating system to the wallet unit, for example, attestation selection in the context of the digital credentials api.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: If a Relying Party supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], the Relying Party's presentation request MAY be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for searching available attestations, for preventing fraud targeting the User, or for troubleshooting purposes. Moreover, the request SHOULD be processed by the browser and/or the Operating System for User security purposes. However, the request SHALL NOT be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for market analysis purposes (including as a secondary purpose) or for the browser's and/or the operating system's own purposes.
requirements.searchText: oia_08c accessing online services with a wallet unit if a relying party supports the [w3c digital credentials api], the relying party's presentation request may be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for searching available attestations, for preventing fraud targeting the user, or for troubleshooting purposes. moreover, the request should be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for user security purposes. however, the request shall not be processed by the browser and/or the operating system for market analysis purposes (including as a secondary purpose) or for the browser's and/or the operating system's own purposes.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL provide a global User setting to disable the disclosure of stored attestations via the Digital Credentials API framework, as described in OIA_08b. When this setting is disabled, the Wallet Unit SHALL NOT advertise or respond to presentation requests or issuance requested communicated via the DC API.
requirements.searchText: oia_08d accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall provide a global user setting to disable the disclosure of stored attestations via the digital credentials api framework, as described in oia_08b. when this setting is disabled, the wallet unit shall not advertise or respond to presentation requests or issuance requested communicated via the dc api.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API], it SHALL use the CTAP-Hybrid flow only if the expectations outlined in Chapter 4 of the [Topic F discussion paper](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md) are met.
requirements.searchText: oia_08e accessing online services with a wallet unit if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api], it shall use the ctap-hybrid flow only if the expectations outlined in chapter 4 of the [topic f discussion paper](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md) are met.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For remote presentation flows the Wallet Unit SHALL ensure that the attributes included in the presented attestation are accessible only to the Relying Party Instance, by encrypting the presentation response. The technical specification meant in OIA_03a SHALL specify mechanisms preventing decryption of the presentation response via Man-in-the-Middle attacks by the browser, the operating system, or other components between the Wallet Unit and the Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: oia_09 accessing online services with a wallet unit for remote presentation flows the wallet unit shall ensure that the attributes included in the presented attestation are accessible only to the relying party instance, by encrypting the presentation response. the technical specification meant in oia_03a shall specify mechanisms preventing decryption of the presentation response via man-in-the-middle attacks by the browser, the operating system, or other components between the wallet unit and the relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a Wallet Unit contains two PIDs having the same encoding (e.g. ISO/IEC 18013-5 or SD-JWT VC-compliant) and a Relying Party requests a PID, the Wallet Unit SHALL ask the User which of these PIDs they want to release, unless the Wallet Unit can decide from context.
requirements.searchText: oia_10 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a wallet unit contains two pids having the same encoding (e.g. iso/iec 18013-5 or sd-jwt vc-compliant) and a relying party requests a pid, the wallet unit shall ask the user which of these pids they want to release, unless the wallet unit can decide from context.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a Wallet Unit contains two attestations having the same encoding (e.g. ISO/IEC 18013-5 or SD-JWT VC-compliant) and the same attestation type, and a Relying Party requests an attestation of that type and encoding, the Wallet Unit SHALL ask the User which of these attestations they want to release, unless the Wallet Unit can decide from context.
requirements.notes: Attestation types are explained in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
requirements.searchText: oia_11 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, if a wallet unit contains two attestations having the same encoding (e.g. iso/iec 18013-5 or sd-jwt vc-compliant) and the same attestation type, and a relying party requests an attestation of that type and encoding, the wallet unit shall ask the user which of these attestations they want to release, unless the wallet unit can decide from context. attestation types are explained in [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)].

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the signature of a PID using a trust anchor provided in a PID Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates).
requirements.searchText: oia_12 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the signature of a pid using a trust anchor provided in a pid provider trusted list made available in accordance with [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the qualified signature of a QEAA in accordance with Art.32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For the verification, the Relying Party SHALL use a trust anchor provided in a QEAA Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation].
requirements.searchText: oia_13 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the qualified signature of a qeaa in accordance with art.32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for the verification, the relying party shall use a trust anchor provided in a qeaa provider trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation].

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the qualified signature of a PuB-EAA in accordance with [Art.32](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2594-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For that verification, the Relying Party SHALL use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the QTSP supporting the qualified signature. The Relying Party SHALL also validate the qualified certificate of the QTSP using a trust anchor provided in a Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. The Relying Party SHALL also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [Article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e3902-1-1).
requirements.searchText: oia_14 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the qualified signature of a pub-eaa in accordance with [art.32](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2594-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. for that verification, the relying party shall use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the qtsp supporting the qualified signature. the relying party shall also validate the qualified certificate of the qtsp using a trust anchor provided in a trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. the relying party shall also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e3902-1-1).

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: For both proximity and remote presentation flows, a Relying Party SHALL validate the signature of a non-qualified EAA using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable Rulebook, see [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
requirements.notes: a) OIA_12 - OIA_15 imply that a Relying Party Instance must know if the attestation it is requesting from a Wallet Instance is a PID, a QEAA, a PuB-EAA, or a non-qualified EAA. These requirements also imply that the Relying Party Instance must store trust anchors in such a way that, at the time of verification, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for PIDs, for QEAAs, for PuB-EAAs, or for non-qualified EAAs. b) PID Providers, QEAA Providers, and PuB-EAA Providers are trusted by other actors in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or PIDs) that they are not legally allowed to issue. This trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. However, non-qualified EAA Providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. Therefore, when it receives an non-qualified attestation, a Relying Party Instance may have to verify that the non-qualified EAA Provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation, in addition to verifying the signature over the attestation using the EAA Provider's trust anchor. Mechanisms allowing to do this should be defined in the applicable Rulebook, see ARB_26.
requirements.searchText: oia_15 accessing online services with a wallet unit for both proximity and remote presentation flows, a relying party shall validate the signature of a non-qualified eaa using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. a) oia_12 - oia_15 imply that a relying party instance must know if the attestation it is requesting from a wallet instance is a pid, a qeaa, a pub-eaa, or a non-qualified eaa. these requirements also imply that the relying party instance must store trust anchors in such a way that, at the time of verification, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for pids, for qeaas, for pub-eaas, or for non-qualified eaas. b) pid providers, qeaa providers, and pub-eaa providers are trusted by other actors in the eudi wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or pids) that they are not legally allowed to issue. this trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. however, non-qualified eaa providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. therefore, when it receives an non-qualified attestation, a relying party instance may have to verify that the non-qualified eaa provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation, in addition to verifying the signature over the attestation using the eaa provider's trust anchor. mechanisms allowing to do this should be defined in the applicable rulebook, see arb_26.

requirements.topicTitle: Accessing Online Services with a Wallet Unit
requirements.specification: When receiving a PID or attestation, a Relying Party Instance SHALL discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement ISSU_35 in [Topic 10](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a237-topic-10---issuing-a-pid-or-attestation-to-a-wallet-unit), as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. The Relying Party Instance SHALL NOT communicate these values to the Relying Party or to any other party inside or outside the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
requirements.searchText: oia_16 accessing online services with a wallet unit when receiving a pid or attestation, a relying party instance shall discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement issu_35 in [topic 10](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a237-topic-10---issuing-a-pid-or-attestation-to-a-wallet-unit), as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. the relying party instance shall not communicate these values to the relying party or to any other party inside or outside the eudi wallet ecosystem.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: PIDs and PID Providers SHALL comply with all requirements in [PID Rulebook].
requirements.searchText: pid_01 pid rulebook pids and pid providers shall comply with all requirements in [pid rulebook].

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: A PID Provider SHALL issue any PID in both the format specified in ISO/IEC 18013-5 [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and the format specified in [SD-JWT VC].
requirements.notes: [CIR 2024/2977] mentions the W3C Verifiable Credentials Data Model v1.1 instead of [SD-JWT VC]. The latest stable version of this standard is [W3C VCDM 2.0].  However, W3C VCDM is not a complete specification of an attestation format. In particular, it does not specify a specific proof method to be used. Without additional specification, such as those in [W3C VC-JOSE-COSE] or [W3C VC Data Integrity], and making further choices, it is impossible to implement a PID based on W3C VCDM. This Rulebook considers [SD-JWT VC] to essentially be such an additional specification. See also [Section 5.3.4](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#534-w3c-verifiable-credentials) of the ARF main document.
requirements.searchText: pid_02 pid rulebook a pid provider shall issue any pid in both the format specified in iso/iec 18013-5 [iso/iec 18013-5] and the format specified in [sd-jwt vc]. [cir 2024/2977] mentions the w3c verifiable credentials data model v1.1 instead of [sd-jwt vc]. the latest stable version of this standard is [w3c vcdm 2.0].  however, w3c vcdm is not a complete specification of an attestation format. in particular, it does not specify a specific proof method to be used. without additional specification, such as those in [w3c vc-jose-cose] or [w3c vc data integrity], and making further choices, it is impossible to implement a pid based on w3c vcdm. this rulebook considers [sd-jwt vc] to essentially be such an additional specification. see also [section 5.3.4](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#534-w3c-verifiable-credentials) of the arf main document.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: The portrait in a PID SHALL consist of a single portrait image in JPEG format. The portrait image SHALL comply with the quality requirements for a Full Frontal Image Type in ISO/IEC 19794-5 clauses 8.2, 8.3, and 8.4. However, the attribute portrait SHALL NOT comply with the format requirements in ISO/IEC 19794-5 clauses 8.1 and 8.5, meaning it SHALL NOT contain any of the headers or blocks specified in clause 5 except for the image data itself (a JPEG).
requirements.searchText: pid_03 pid rulebook the portrait in a pid shall consist of a single portrait image in jpeg format. the portrait image shall comply with the quality requirements for a full frontal image type in iso/iec 19794-5 clauses 8.2, 8.3, and 8.4. however, the attribute portrait shall not comply with the format requirements in iso/iec 19794-5 clauses 8.1 and 8.5, meaning it shall not contain any of the headers or blocks specified in clause 5 except for the image data itself (a jpeg).

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: PID Providers SHALL use eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.1 as the attestation type for ISO/IEC 18013-5-compliant PIDs.
requirements.notes: a) This identifier uses the general format [Reverse Domain].[Domain Specific Extension]. Since the European Commission controls the domain ec.europa.eu, this attestation type identifier will not collide with any attestation type identifiers defined by other organisations in other Attestation Rulebooks. b) The version number 1 in this identifier is used to distinguish between the first version of the PID, defined in the [PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md), and any future version, which will then have an incremented version number.
requirements.searchText: pid_04 pid rulebook pid providers shall use eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.1 as the attestation type for iso/iec 18013-5-compliant pids. a) this identifier uses the general format [reverse domain].[domain specific extension]. since the european commission controls the domain ec.europa.eu, this attestation type identifier will not collide with any attestation type identifiers defined by other organisations in other attestation rulebooks. b) the version number 1 in this identifier is used to distinguish between the first version of the pid, defined in the [pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md), and any future version, which will then have an incremented version number.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL use the value eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.1 for the identifier of the namespace for the PID attributes specified in [Section 4.2 of the PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#42-encoding-of-pid-attributes-and-metadata).
requirements.notes: a) The version number 1 allows for future extension(s) or change(s) of the ISO/IEC 18013-5-compliant PID attributes. b) This namespace has the same value as the attestation type specified in requirement PID_04. This is allowed according to ISO/IEC 18013-5.
requirements.searchText: pid_05 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall use the value eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.1 for the identifier of the namespace for the pid attributes specified in [section 4.2 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#42-encoding-of-pid-attributes-and-metadata). a) the version number 1 allows for future extension(s) or change(s) of the iso/iec 18013-5-compliant pid attributes. b) this namespace has the same value as the attestation type specified in requirement pid_04. this is allowed according to iso/iec 18013-5.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider MAY include attributes that are not defined in the [PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md). If so, these attributes SHALL be defined within a domestic PID namespace as meant in requirement ARB_10 in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks). The PID Provider SHALL generate the identifier for this domestic PID namespace by appending the applicable ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the ISO 3166-2 region code, separated by a period, to the PID namespace identifier specified in PID_05, excluding the version number. The PID Provider MAY include a version number in the domestic PID namespace identifier.
requirements.notes: For example, the identifier of the first domestic PID namespace for Germany could be eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.de.1
requirements.searchText: pid_06 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider may include attributes that are not defined in the [pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md). if so, these attributes shall be defined within a domestic pid namespace as meant in requirement arb_10 in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks). the pid provider shall generate the identifier for this domestic pid namespace by appending the applicable iso 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the iso 3166-2 region code, separated by a period, to the pid namespace identifier specified in pid_05, excluding the version number. the pid provider may include a version number in the domestic pid namespace identifier. for example, the identifier of the first domestic pid namespace for germany could be eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.de.1

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: A PID Provider that defines a domestic namespace SHALL publish the namespace, including all attribute identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an Attestation Rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
requirements.searchText: pid_07 pid rulebook a pid provider that defines a domestic namespace shall publish the namespace, including all attribute identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an attestation rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [CIR 2024/2977] in the PID as (issuer-signed or device-signed) data elements.
requirements.notes: This implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.
requirements.searchText: pid_08 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [cir 2024/2977] in the pid as (issuer-signed or device-signed) data elements. this implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID as specified in the third column of the tables in [Section 4.2.1 of the PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#421-overview).
requirements.searchText: pid_09 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid as specified in the third column of the tables in [section 4.2.1 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#421-overview).

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID in Concise Binary Object Representation (CBOR) according to [RFC 8949].
requirements.searchText: pid_10 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid in concise binary object representation (cbor) according to [rfc 8949].

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that each PID contains at most one attribute with the same attribute identifier.
requirements.searchText: pid_11 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that each pid contains at most one attribute with the same attribute identifier.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the PID is valid at the value of the timestamp in the validFrom element in the MSO, see [ISO/IEC 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.
requirements.notes: The value of the age_over_18, age_over_NN, or age_in_years attributes, if present, changes whenever the User to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. The value of many other attributes will also change over time.
requirements.searchText: pid_12 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the pid is valid at the value of the timestamp in the validfrom element in the mso, see [iso/iec 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4. the value of the age_over_18, age_over_nn, or age_in_years attributes, if present, changes whenever the user to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. the value of many other attributes will also change over time.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the issuance_date attribute, if present, is not later than the validFrom element in the MSO, see [ISO/IEC 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.
requirements.searchText: pid_13 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that the issuance_date attribute, if present, is not later than the validfrom element in the mso, see [iso/iec 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: A PID Provider issuing [SD-JWT VC]-compliant PIDs SHALL include the vct claim in their PIDs, where the vct claim SHALL be a URN within the `urn:eudi:pid:` namespace. The type indicated by the vct claim SHALL be `urn:eudi:pid:1` for the type defined in this document or a domestic type that extends it.
requirements.searchText: pid_14 pid rulebook a pid provider issuing [sd-jwt vc]-compliant pids shall include the vct claim in their pids, where the vct claim shall be a urn within the `urn:eudi:pid:` namespace. the type indicated by the vct claim shall be `urn:eudi:pid:1` for the type defined in this document or a domestic type that extends it.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: pid_15 pid rulebook empty

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: A PID Provider that defines a domestic type SHALL publish information about the type, including all claim identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an Attestation Rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
requirements.searchText: pid_16 pid rulebook a pid provider that defines a domestic type shall publish information about the type, including all claim identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an attestation rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [CIR 2024/2977] in the PID as claims.
requirements.notes: This implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.
requirements.searchText: pid_17 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [cir 2024/2977] in the pid as claims. this implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID as specified in the tables in [Section 5.2 of the PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#52-encoding-of-pid-attributes).
requirements.searchText: pid_18 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid as specified in the tables in [section 5.2 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#52-encoding-of-pid-attributes).

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the PID is valid at the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.
requirements.notes: The value of the age-related claims, if present, changes whenever the User to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. The value of many other attributes will also change over time.
requirements.searchText: pid_19 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the pid is valid at the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present. the value of the age-related claims, if present, changes whenever the user to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. the value of many other attributes will also change over time.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the date_of_issuance claim, if present, is not later than the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.
requirements.searchText: pid_20 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall ensure that the date_of_issuance claim, if present, is not later than the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.

requirements.topicTitle: PID Rulebook
requirements.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
requirements.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL make all claims (i.e., all top-level properties, all nested properties, and all array entries) selectively disclosable individually, except those claims defined as non-selectively disclosable in [SD-JWT VC].
requirements.searchText: pid_21 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall make all claims (i.e., all top-level properties, all nested properties, and all array entries) selectively disclosable individually, except those claims defined as non-selectively disclosable in [sd-jwt vc].

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: The Wallet Unit used by a User, as well as the Relying Party Instance used by the Relying Party, SHALL implement a mechanism for Relying Party authentication in PID or attestation presentation transactions. This mechanism SHALL: - enable the Wallet Unit to identify and authenticate the Relying Party, - enable the Wallet Unit to verify that the request from the Relying Party was not copied and replayed, - use Relying Party Instance access certificates issued in accordance with [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties).
requirements.searchText: rpa_01 relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit used by a user, as well as the relying party instance used by the relying party, shall implement a mechanism for relying party authentication in pid or attestation presentation transactions. this mechanism shall: - enable the wallet unit to identify and authenticate the relying party, - enable the wallet unit to verify that the request from the relying party was not copied and replayed, - use relying party instance access certificates issued in accordance with [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)].

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_01. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
requirements.searchText: rpa_01a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_01. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: The Commission SHALL ensure that technical specifications for the Relying Party authentication mechanism mentioned in RPA_01 are created both for Wallet Units complying with [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and for Wallet Units complying with [OpenID4VP]. These specifications SHALL comply with applicable requirements in these standards.
requirements.searchText: rpa_02 relying party authentication and user approval the commission shall ensure that technical specifications for the relying party authentication mechanism mentioned in rpa_01 are created both for wallet units complying with [iso/iec 18013-5] and for wallet units complying with [openid4vp]. these specifications shall comply with applicable requirements in these standards.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: The technical specifications mentioned in RPA_02 SHALL ensure that a Relying Party Instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference.
requirements.notes: This ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out Relying Party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.
requirements.searchText: rpa_02a relying party authentication and user approval the technical specifications mentioned in rpa_02 shall ensure that a relying party instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference. this ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out relying party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit and a Relying Party Instance SHALL perform Relying Party authentication in all PID or attestation presentation transactions to Relying Parties, whether proximity or remote, using a Relying Party Instance access certificate.
requirements.notes: The actions both entities perform differ. For example, while the Relying Party creates a signature over some data in the request, the Wallet Unit validates that signature.
requirements.searchText: rpa_03 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit and a relying party instance shall perform relying party authentication in all pid or attestation presentation transactions to relying parties, whether proximity or remote, using a relying party instance access certificate. the actions both entities perform differ. for example, while the relying party creates a signature over some data in the request, the wallet unit validates that signature.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: For the verification of Relying Party Instance access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Trusted List(s) of Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities of all Member States.
requirements.notes: For more information about Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities, please see [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates).
requirements.searchText: rpa_04 relying party authentication and user approval for the verification of relying party instance access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in the trusted list(s) of relying party access certificate authorities of all member states. for more information about relying party access certificate authorities, please see [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Instance SHALL inform the User that the identity of the Relying Party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.
requirements.searchText: rpa_05 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet instance shall inform the user that the identity of the relying party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: If Relying Party authentication succeeds, the Wallet Instance SHALL display to the User the name of the Relying Party as included in the Relying Party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the Relying Party. The Wallet Instance SHALL do so when asking the User for approval according to RPA_07.
requirements.notes: If the Relying Party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party, the Wallet Instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party to the User, see RPI_07.
requirements.searchText: rpa_06 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication succeeds, the wallet instance shall display to the user the name of the relying party as included in the relying party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the relying party. the wallet instance shall do so when asking the user for approval according to rpa_07. if the relying party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated relying party, the wallet instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated relying party to the user, see rpi_07.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Unit SHALL notify the User. In addition, the Wallet Unit SHALL either not present the requested attributes to the Relying Party, or give the User the choice to present the requested attributes or not.
requirements.notes: It is up to the Wallet Provider to make a choice for one of these two options.
requirements.searchText: rpa_06a relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet unit shall notify the user. in addition, the wallet unit shall either not present the requested attributes to the relying party, or give the user the choice to present the requested attributes or not. it is up to the wallet provider to make a choice for one of these two options.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL ensure the User approved the release of any attribute(s) in the Wallet Unit to a Relying Party, prior to releasing these attributes. A Wallet Unit SHALL always allow the User to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the Relying Party.
requirements.searchText: rpa_07 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall ensure the user approved the release of any attribute(s) in the wallet unit to a relying party, prior to releasing these attributes. a wallet unit shall always allow the user to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the relying party.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_07. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
requirements.searchText: rpa_07a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_07. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate the User before allowing the User to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with WIAM_14 or WIAM_15, as applicable.
requirements.searchText: rpa_08 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall authenticate the user before allowing the user to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with wiam_14 or wiam_15, as applicable.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: Empty
requirements.searchText: rpa_09 relying party authentication and user approval empty

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit SHALL show to the User the User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy.
requirements.notes: The User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. The link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the Wallet Unit obtained the link from the Registrar's online service, if the User requested this. See RPRC_19a and other requirements in [Topic 44](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.
requirements.searchText: rpa_10 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit shall show to the user the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy. the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. the link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the wallet unit obtained the link from the registrar's online service, if the user requested this. see rprc_19a and other requirements in [topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: The Wallet Unit SHOULD ensure that the User gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them.
requirements.notes: This means that a User should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. The Wallet Unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the Relying Party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some User attributes. This would be a violation of the User's privacy. Note that a Relying Party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. So if the User feels that the Relying Party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the Relying Party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.
requirements.searchText: rpa_10a relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit should ensure that the user gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them. this means that a user should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. the wallet unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the relying party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some user attributes. this would be a violation of the user's privacy. note that a relying party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. so if the user feels that the relying party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the relying party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: When the presentation of an attestation is denied by the User, the Wallet Unit SHALL behave towards the Relying Party as if the attestation did not exist.
requirements.searchText: rpa_11 relying party authentication and user approval when the presentation of an attestation is denied by the user, the wallet unit shall behave towards the relying party as if the attestation did not exist.

requirements.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
requirements.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit MAY indicate to the User whether the attestation requested by a Relying Party is device-bound or not.
requirements.notes: The intent of this indication is to warn the User than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the Relying Party and presented to a third party.
requirements.searchText: rpa_12 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit may indicate to the user whether the attestation requested by a relying party is device-bound or not. the intent of this indication is to warn the user than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the relying party and presented to a third party.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A PID Provider, QEAA Provider, or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL use one of the following methods for revocation of a PID, QEAA, or PuB-EAA: - Only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - Use an Attestation Status List mechanism specified per VCR_11, or - Use an Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
requirements.notes: The 24-hour period originates from ETSI EN 319 411-1 V1.4.1, requirement REV-6.2.4-03A. This requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. Consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.
requirements.searchText: vcr_01 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, qeaa provider, or pub-eaa provider shall use one of the following methods for revocation of a pid, qeaa, or pub-eaa: - only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - use an attestation status list mechanism specified per vcr_11, or - use an attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. the 24-hour period originates from etsi en 319 411-1 v1.4.1, requirement rev-6.2.4-03a. this requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL use either the second or the third of the methods specified in VCR_01 for revocation of a WUA.
requirements.notes: Due to requirement WUA_08 in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived WUAs. This implies that all WUAs are revocable.
requirements.searchText: vcr_01a attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall use either the second or the third of the methods specified in vcr_01 for revocation of a wua. due to requirement wua_08 in [topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived wuas. this implies that all wuas are revocable.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: For non-qualified EAAs, the relevant Rulebook SHALL specify whether that type of EAA must be revocable. If a non-qualified EAA type must be revocable, the relevant Rulebook SHALL determine which of the methods mentioned in VCR_01 must be implemented by the relevant EAA Providers for the revocation of such an EAA.
requirements.searchText: vcr_02 attestation revocation and revocation checking for non-qualified eaas, the relevant rulebook shall specify whether that type of eaa must be revocable. if a non-qualified eaa type must be revocable, the relevant rulebook shall determine which of the methods mentioned in vcr_01 must be implemented by the relevant eaa providers for the revocation of such an eaa.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider of a given PID, or the Attestation Provider of a given attestation, SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that PID or attestation. *Note: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
requirements.searchText: vcr_03 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider of a given pid, or the attestation provider of a given attestation, shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that pid or attestation. *note: a pid provider, attestation provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: The Wallet Provider of a given WUA SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that WUA.
requirements.notes: A Wallet Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
requirements.searchText: vcr_03a attestation revocation and revocation checking the wallet provider of a given wua shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that wua. a wallet provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider that revoked a PID, attestation, or WUA SHALL NOT reverse the revocation.
requirements.searchText: vcr_04 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider that revoked a pid, attestation, or wua shall not reverse the revocation.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL have a policy specifying under which conditions a PID, attestation, or WUA it issued will be revoked.
requirements.searchText: vcr_05 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall have a policy specifying under which conditions a pid, attestation, or wua it issued will be revoked.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA when its security has been compromised.
requirements.searchText: vcr_06 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua when its security has been compromised.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL revoke all valid WUAs issued to a Wallet Unit upon the explicit request of the User to revoke their Wallet Unit.
requirements.searchText: vcr_07 attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall revoke all valid wuas issued to a wallet unit upon the explicit request of the user to revoke their wallet unit.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID or attestation upon the explicit request of the User to whom the PID or the attestation was issued.
requirements.searchText: vcr_07a attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid or attestation upon the explicit request of the user to whom the pid or the attestation was issued.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID if the Wallet Unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement WURevocation_18 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).
requirements.searchText: vcr_07b attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid if the wallet unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement wurevocation_18 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID is revocable, the PID Provider SHALL revoke a PID upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the PID, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the PID.
requirements.searchText: vcr_08 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid is revocable, the pid provider shall revoke a pid upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the pid, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the pid.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA if the value of one or more attributes in the PID, attestation, or WUA was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. Subsequently, if the User's contact details are known, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHOULD, via an out-of-band manner, notify the User about the revocation and ask the User to request re-issuance of the PID, attestation, or WUA using their Wallet Unit.
requirements.notes: If the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the Provider, such as an Authentic Source, the Provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.
requirements.searchText: vcr_09 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua if the value of one or more attributes in the pid, attestation, or wua was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. subsequently, if the user's contact details are known, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider should, via an out-of-band manner, notify the user about the revocation and ask the user to request re-issuance of the pid, attestation, or wua using their wallet unit. if the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the provider, such as an authentic source, the provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per VCR_11 in their Wallet Solutions.
requirements.searchText: vcr_10 attestation revocation and revocation checking wallet providers shall implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per vcr_11 in their wallet solutions.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: The Commission SHALL create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers to implement an Attestation Status List mechanism or an Attestation Revocation List mechanism for the PIDs, attestations, and WUAs they issue. These technical specifications SHALL also contain all details necessary for Relying Party Instances, Relying Parties, and Wallet Units interacting with other Wallet Units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of PIDs, attestations, and WUAs.
requirements.notes: 'Attestation Status List' and 'Attestation Revocation List' are specific mechanisms, defined in Annex 1. Attestation Revocation Lists are sometimes referred to as 'Identifier Lists'.
requirements.searchText: vcr_11 attestation revocation and revocation checking the commission shall create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers to implement an attestation status list mechanism or an attestation revocation list mechanism for the pids, attestations, and wuas they issue. these technical specifications shall also contain all details necessary for relying party instances, relying parties, and wallet units interacting with other wallet units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of pids, attestations, and wuas. 'attestation status list' and 'attestation revocation list' are specific mechanisms, defined in annex 1. attestation revocation lists are sometimes referred to as 'identifier lists'.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: If a Relying Party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of PIDs or attestations, it SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
requirements.notes: Per VCR_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a Relying Party to verify whether a PID or attestation is revoked.
requirements.searchText: vcr_12 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a relying party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of pids or attestations, it shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. per vcr_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a relying party to verify whether a pid or attestation is revoked.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11 for verifying the revocation status of a WUA.
requirements.searchText: vcr_12a attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider or attestation provider shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11 for verifying the revocation status of a wua.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD verify the revocation status of a PID or attestation upon obtaining it from a Wallet Unit, following the steps specified per VCR_11.
requirements.searchText: vcr_13 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should verify the revocation status of a pid or attestation upon obtaining it from a wallet unit, following the steps specified per vcr_11.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: When no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a PID or attestation is available, a Relying Party SHOULD perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the PID or attestation.
requirements.searchText: vcr_14 attestation revocation and revocation checking when no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a pid or attestation is available, a relying party should perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the pid or attestation.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD NOT request the relevant Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List each time an attestation is presented to it by a Wallet Unit. Rather, the Relying Party operating the Relying Party Instance SHOULD download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a PID or attestation by a User. The Relying Party SHOULD then distribute the list to all of its Relying Party Instances, using an Relying Party-internal distribution mechanism.
requirements.searchText: vcr_15 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should not request the relevant attestation status list or attestation revocation list each time an attestation is presented to it by a wallet unit. rather, the relying party operating the relying party instance should download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a pid or attestation by a user. the relying party should then distribute the list to all of its relying party instances, using an relying party-internal distribution mechanism.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL NOT require the Relying Party or Relying Party Instance to authenticate itself before downloading an Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List.
requirements.searchText: vcr_16 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall not require the relying party or relying party instance to authenticate itself before downloading an attestation status list or attestation revocation list.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL randomly assign the index for each PID or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator.
requirements.notes: Randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an Attestation Revocation List. This is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.
requirements.searchText: vcr_17 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall randomly assign the index for each pid or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator. randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an attestation revocation list. this is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL represent a sufficiently large number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs on each Attestation Status List to ensure herd privacy.
requirements.notes: In this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider is not able to deduce which PID, attestation or WUA (likely) was presented to that entity. Complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs to be represented on the list is small. In such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced PIDs, attestations, or WUAs.
requirements.searchText: vcr_18 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall represent a sufficiently large number of pids, attestations, or wuas on each attestation status list to ensure herd privacy. in this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider is not able to deduce which pid, attestation or wua (likely) was presented to that entity. complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of pids, attestations, or wuas to be represented on the list is small. in such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced pids, attestations, or wuas.

requirements.topicTitle: Attestation revocation and revocation checking
requirements.specification: A Wallet Unit SHOULD regularly check the revocation status of its PIDs, attestations, and WUAs, and notify the User if a PID, attestation, or WUA (i.e, the Wallet Unit itself), is revoked.
