PID_05.searchText: pid_05 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall use the value eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.1 for the identifier of the namespace for the pid attributes specified in [section 4.2 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#42-encoding-of-pid-attributes-and-metadata). a) the version number 1 allows for future extension(s) or change(s) of the iso/iec 18013-5-compliant pid attributes. b) this namespace has the same value as the attestation type specified in requirement pid_04. this is allowed according to iso/iec 18013-5.

PID_06.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider MAY include attributes that are not defined in the [PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md). If so, these attributes SHALL be defined within a domestic PID namespace as meant in requirement ARB_10 in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks). The PID Provider SHALL generate the identifier for this domestic PID namespace by appending the applicable ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the ISO 3166-2 region code, separated by a period, to the PID namespace identifier specified in PID_05, excluding the version number. The PID Provider MAY include a version number in the domestic PID namespace identifier.
PID_06.notes: For example, the identifier of the first domestic PID namespace for Germany could be eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.de.1
PID_06.searchText: pid_06 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider may include attributes that are not defined in the [pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md). if so, these attributes shall be defined within a domestic pid namespace as meant in requirement arb_10 in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks). the pid provider shall generate the identifier for this domestic pid namespace by appending the applicable iso 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the iso 3166-2 region code, separated by a period, to the pid namespace identifier specified in pid_05, excluding the version number. the pid provider may include a version number in the domestic pid namespace identifier. for example, the identifier of the first domestic pid namespace for germany could be eu.europa.ec.eudi.pid.de.1

PID_07.specification: A PID Provider that defines a domestic namespace SHALL publish the namespace, including all attribute identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an Attestation Rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
PID_07.searchText: pid_07 pid rulebook a pid provider that defines a domestic namespace shall publish the namespace, including all attribute identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an attestation rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).

PID_08.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [CIR 2024/2977] in the PID as (issuer-signed or device-signed) data elements.
PID_08.notes: This implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.
PID_08.searchText: pid_08 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [cir 2024/2977] in the pid as (issuer-signed or device-signed) data elements. this implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.

PID_09.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID as specified in the third column of the tables in [Section 4.2.1 of the PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#421-overview).
PID_09.searchText: pid_09 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid as specified in the third column of the tables in [section 4.2.1 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#421-overview).

PID_10.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID in Concise Binary Object Representation (CBOR) according to [RFC 8949].
PID_10.searchText: pid_10 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid in concise binary object representation (cbor) according to [rfc 8949].

PID_11.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that each PID contains at most one attribute with the same attribute identifier.
PID_11.searchText: pid_11 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that each pid contains at most one attribute with the same attribute identifier.

PID_12.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the PID is valid at the value of the timestamp in the validFrom element in the MSO, see [ISO/IEC 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.
PID_12.notes: The value of the age_over_18, age_over_NN, or age_in_years attributes, if present, changes whenever the User to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. The value of many other attributes will also change over time.
PID_12.searchText: pid_12 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the pid is valid at the value of the timestamp in the validfrom element in the mso, see [iso/iec 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4. the value of the age_over_18, age_over_nn, or age_in_years attributes, if present, changes whenever the user to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. the value of many other attributes will also change over time.

PID_13.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [ISO/IEC 18013-5], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the issuance_date attribute, if present, is not later than the validFrom element in the MSO, see [ISO/IEC 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.
PID_13.searchText: pid_13 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [iso/iec 18013-5], a pid provider shall ensure that the issuance_date attribute, if present, is not later than the validfrom element in the mso, see [iso/iec 18013-5] clause 9.1.2.4.

PID_14.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_14.specification: A PID Provider issuing [SD-JWT VC]-compliant PIDs SHALL include the vct claim in their PIDs, where the vct claim SHALL be a URN within the `urn:eudi:pid:` namespace. The type indicated by the vct claim SHALL be `urn:eudi:pid:1` for the type defined in this document or a domestic type that extends it.
PID_14.searchText: pid_14 pid rulebook a pid provider issuing [sd-jwt vc]-compliant pids shall include the vct claim in their pids, where the vct claim shall be a urn within the `urn:eudi:pid:` namespace. the type indicated by the vct claim shall be `urn:eudi:pid:1` for the type defined in this document or a domestic type that extends it.

PID_15.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs

PID_16.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_16.specification: A PID Provider that defines a domestic type SHALL publish information about the type, including all claim identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an Attestation Rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
PID_16.searchText: pid_16 pid rulebook a pid provider that defines a domestic type shall publish information about the type, including all claim identifiers, their definition, presence and encoding format, in an attestation rulebook complying with all applicable requirements in [topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).

PID_17.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_17.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [CIR 2024/2977] in the PID as claims.
PID_17.notes: This implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.
PID_17.searchText: pid_17 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall include both the attributes and the metadata specified in [cir 2024/2977] in the pid as claims. this implies that technically speaking, there is no difference between these attributes and metadata.

PID_18.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_18.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL encode each attribute or metadata in the PID as specified in the tables in [Section 5.2 of the PID Rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#52-encoding-of-pid-attributes).
PID_18.searchText: pid_18 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall encode each attribute or metadata in the pid as specified in the tables in [section 5.2 of the pid rulebook](../annex-3/annex-3.01-pid-rulebook.md#52-encoding-of-pid-attributes).

PID_19.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_19.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the PID is valid at the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.
PID_19.notes: The value of the age-related claims, if present, changes whenever the User to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. The value of many other attributes will also change over time.
PID_19.searchText: pid_19 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall ensure that the value of all attributes and metadata in the pid is valid at the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present. the value of the age-related claims, if present, changes whenever the user to whom the person identification data relates has a relevant birthday. the value of many other attributes will also change over time.

PID_20.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_20.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL ensure that the date_of_issuance claim, if present, is not later than the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.
PID_20.searchText: pid_20 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall ensure that the date_of_issuance claim, if present, is not later than the value of the timestamp in the nbf claim, if present.

PID_21.subsection: C. HLRs for SD-JWT VC-compliant PIDs
PID_21.specification: When issuing a PID compliant with [SD-JWT VC], a PID Provider SHALL make all claims (i.e., all top-level properties, all nested properties, and all array entries) selectively disclosable individually, except those claims defined as non-selectively disclosable in [SD-JWT VC].
PID_21.searchText: pid_21 pid rulebook when issuing a pid compliant with [sd-jwt vc], a pid provider shall make all claims (i.e., all top-level properties, all nested properties, and all array entries) selectively disclosable individually, except those claims defined as non-selectively disclosable in [sd-jwt vc].

RPA_01.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_01.specification: The Wallet Unit used by a User, as well as the Relying Party Instance used by the Relying Party, SHALL implement a mechanism for Relying Party authentication in PID or attestation presentation transactions. This mechanism SHALL: - enable the Wallet Unit to identify and authenticate the Relying Party, - enable the Wallet Unit to verify that the request from the Relying Party was not copied and replayed, - use Relying Party Instance access certificates issued in accordance with [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties).
RPA_01.searchText: rpa_01 relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit used by a user, as well as the relying party instance used by the relying party, shall implement a mechanism for relying party authentication in pid or attestation presentation transactions. this mechanism shall: - enable the wallet unit to identify and authenticate the relying party, - enable the wallet unit to verify that the request from the relying party was not copied and replayed, - use relying party instance access certificates issued in accordance with [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)].

RPA_01a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_01a.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_01. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
RPA_01a.searchText: rpa_01a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_01. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

RPA_02.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_02.specification: The Commission SHALL ensure that technical specifications for the Relying Party authentication mechanism mentioned in RPA_01 are created both for Wallet Units complying with [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and for Wallet Units complying with [OpenID4VP]. These specifications SHALL comply with applicable requirements in these standards.
RPA_02.searchText: rpa_02 relying party authentication and user approval the commission shall ensure that technical specifications for the relying party authentication mechanism mentioned in rpa_01 are created both for wallet units complying with [iso/iec 18013-5] and for wallet units complying with [openid4vp]. these specifications shall comply with applicable requirements in these standards.

RPA_02a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_02a.specification: The technical specifications mentioned in RPA_02 SHALL ensure that a Relying Party Instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference.
RPA_02a.notes: This ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out Relying Party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.
RPA_02a.searchText: rpa_02a relying party authentication and user approval the technical specifications mentioned in rpa_02 shall ensure that a relying party instance includes its access certificates in the presentation request by value, not by reference. this ensures that no external requests are necessary to carry out relying party authentication, and that transactions are atomic and self-contained.

RPA_03.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_03.specification: A Wallet Unit and a Relying Party Instance SHALL perform Relying Party authentication in all PID or attestation presentation transactions to Relying Parties, whether proximity or remote, using a Relying Party Instance access certificate.
RPA_03.notes: The actions both entities perform differ. For example, while the Relying Party creates a signature over some data in the request, the Wallet Unit validates that signature.
RPA_03.searchText: rpa_03 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit and a relying party instance shall perform relying party authentication in all pid or attestation presentation transactions to relying parties, whether proximity or remote, using a relying party instance access certificate. the actions both entities perform differ. for example, while the relying party creates a signature over some data in the request, the wallet unit validates that signature.

RPA_04.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_04.specification: For the verification of Relying Party Instance access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Trusted List(s) of Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities of all Member States.
RPA_04.notes: For more information about Relying Party Access Certificate Authorities, please see [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates).
RPA_04.searchText: rpa_04 relying party authentication and user approval for the verification of relying party instance access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in the trusted list(s) of relying party access certificate authorities of all member states. for more information about relying party access certificate authorities, please see [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

RPA_05.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_05.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Instance SHALL inform the User that the identity of the Relying Party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.
RPA_05.searchText: rpa_05 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet instance shall inform the user that the identity of the relying party could not be verified and that therefore the request is not trustworthy.

RPA_06.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_06.specification: If Relying Party authentication succeeds, the Wallet Instance SHALL display to the User the name of the Relying Party as included in the Relying Party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the Relying Party. The Wallet Instance SHALL do so when asking the User for approval according to RPA_07.
RPA_06.notes: If the Relying Party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated Relying Party, the Wallet Instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated Relying Party to the User, see RPI_07.
RPA_06.searchText: rpa_06 relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication succeeds, the wallet instance shall display to the user the name of the relying party as included in the relying party access certificate, together with the attributes requested by the relying party. the wallet instance shall do so when asking the user for approval according to rpa_07. if the relying party is an intermediary acting on behalf of an intermediated relying party, the wallet instance displays the names of both the intermediary and the intermediated relying party to the user, see rpi_07.

RPA_06a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_06a.specification: If Relying Party authentication fails for any reason, the Wallet Unit SHALL notify the User. In addition, the Wallet Unit SHALL either not present the requested attributes to the Relying Party, or give the User the choice to present the requested attributes or not.
RPA_06a.notes: It is up to the Wallet Provider to make a choice for one of these two options.
RPA_06a.searchText: rpa_06a relying party authentication and user approval if relying party authentication fails for any reason, the wallet unit shall notify the user. in addition, the wallet unit shall either not present the requested attributes to the relying party, or give the user the choice to present the requested attributes or not. it is up to the wallet provider to make a choice for one of these two options.

RPA_07.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_07.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL ensure the User approved the release of any attribute(s) in the Wallet Unit to a Relying Party, prior to releasing these attributes. A Wallet Unit SHALL always allow the User to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the Relying Party.
RPA_07.searchText: rpa_07 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall ensure the user approved the release of any attribute(s) in the wallet unit to a relying party, prior to releasing these attributes. a wallet unit shall always allow the user to refuse releasing an attribute requested by the relying party.

RPA_07a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_07a.specification: If a Wallet Unit supports the [W3C Digital Credentials API] for remote presentation flows, it SHALL retain full authority over the process meant in RPA_07. In particular, this process SHALL NOT be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.
RPA_07a.searchText: rpa_07a relying party authentication and user approval if a wallet unit supports the [w3c digital credentials api] for remote presentation flows, it shall retain full authority over the process meant in rpa_07. in particular, this process shall not be handled by a third party, including the browser and the operating system.

RPA_08.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_08.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate the User before allowing the User to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with WIAM_14 or WIAM_15, as applicable.
RPA_08.searchText: rpa_08 relying party authentication and user approval a wallet unit shall authenticate the user before allowing the user to give or refuse approval for releasing any attributes, in accordance with wiam_14 or wiam_15, as applicable.

RPA_09.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_09.searchText: rpa_09 relying party authentication and user approval empty

RPA_10.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_10.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit SHALL show to the User the User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy.
RPA_10.notes: The User-friendly description of the Relying Party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. The link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the Wallet Unit obtained the link from the Registrar's online service, if the User requested this. See RPRC_19a and other requirements in [Topic 44](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.
RPA_10.searchText: rpa_10 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit shall show to the user the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use and, if available, the link to the applicable privacy policy. the user-friendly description of the relying party's intended use is included in  the presentation request and also in the registration certificate, if available. the link to the privacy policy is included in the registration certificate, or in the absence of a registration certificate, the wallet unit obtained the link from the registrar's online service, if the user requested this. see rprc_19a and other requirements in [topic 44](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2326-topic-44---registration-certificates-for-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) for details.

RPA_10a.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_10a.specification: The Wallet Unit SHOULD ensure that the User gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them.
RPA_10a.notes: This means that a User should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. The Wallet Unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the Relying Party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some User attributes. This would be a violation of the User's privacy. Note that a Relying Party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. So if the User feels that the Relying Party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the Relying Party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.
RPA_10a.searchText: rpa_10a relying party authentication and user approval the wallet unit should ensure that the user gives approval either to present all attributes requested in a presentation request, or none of them. this means that a user should be asked either to approve the presentation of all requested attributes or to deny all of them. the wallet unit should not allow partial approval, since this would mean that the relying party cannot deliver the service, but nevertheless receives some user attributes. this would be a violation of the user's privacy. note that a relying party is not allowed to request more data than is justified for the intended use. so if the user feels that the relying party is actually requesting more data than needed, that implies that the relying party is not trustworthy and should not receive any data.

RPA_11.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_11.specification: When the presentation of an attestation is denied by the User, the Wallet Unit SHALL behave towards the Relying Party as if the attestation did not exist.
RPA_11.searchText: rpa_11 relying party authentication and user approval when the presentation of an attestation is denied by the user, the wallet unit shall behave towards the relying party as if the attestation did not exist.

RPA_12.topicTitle: Relying Party authentication and User approval
RPA_12.specification: When asking for User approval, the Wallet Unit MAY indicate to the User whether the attestation requested by a Relying Party is device-bound or not.
RPA_12.notes: The intent of this indication is to warn the User than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the Relying Party and presented to a third party.
RPA_12.searchText: rpa_12 relying party authentication and user approval when asking for user approval, the wallet unit may indicate to the user whether the attestation requested by a relying party is device-bound or not. the intent of this indication is to warn the user than a non-device bound attestation may be copied by the relying party and presented to a third party.

VCR_01.specification: A PID Provider, QEAA Provider, or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL use one of the following methods for revocation of a PID, QEAA, or PuB-EAA: - Only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - Use an Attestation Status List mechanism specified per VCR_11, or - Use an Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
VCR_01.notes: The 24-hour period originates from ETSI EN 319 411-1 V1.4.1, requirement REV-6.2.4-03A. This requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. Consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.
VCR_01.searchText: vcr_01 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, qeaa provider, or pub-eaa provider shall use one of the following methods for revocation of a pid, qeaa, or pub-eaa: - only issue short-lived attestations having a validity period of 24 hours or less, such that revocation will never be necessary, - use an attestation status list mechanism specified per vcr_11, or - use an attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. the 24-hour period originates from etsi en 319 411-1 v1.4.1, requirement rev-6.2.4-03a. this requires that the process of revocation must take at most 24 hours. consequently, revocation may make no sense if the attestation is valid for less than 24 hours, because it may reach the end of its validity period before it is revoked.

VCR_01a.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL use either the second or the third of the methods specified in VCR_01 for revocation of a WUA.
VCR_01a.notes: Due to requirement WUA_08 in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived WUAs. This implies that all WUAs are revocable.
VCR_01a.searchText: vcr_01a attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall use either the second or the third of the methods specified in vcr_01 for revocation of a wua. due to requirement wua_08 in [topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation), it is not possible to issue short-lived wuas. this implies that all wuas are revocable.

VCR_02.specification: For non-qualified EAAs, the relevant Rulebook SHALL specify whether that type of EAA must be revocable. If a non-qualified EAA type must be revocable, the relevant Rulebook SHALL determine which of the methods mentioned in VCR_01 must be implemented by the relevant EAA Providers for the revocation of such an EAA.
VCR_02.searchText: vcr_02 attestation revocation and revocation checking for non-qualified eaas, the relevant rulebook shall specify whether that type of eaa must be revocable. if a non-qualified eaa type must be revocable, the relevant rulebook shall determine which of the methods mentioned in vcr_01 must be implemented by the relevant eaa providers for the revocation of such an eaa.

VCR_03.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider of a given PID, or the Attestation Provider of a given attestation, SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that PID or attestation. *Note: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
VCR_03.searchText: vcr_03 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider of a given pid, or the attestation provider of a given attestation, shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that pid or attestation. *note: a pid provider, attestation provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

VCR_03a.specification: The Wallet Provider of a given WUA SHALL be the only party in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that WUA.
VCR_03a.notes: A Wallet Provider MAY outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.
VCR_03a.searchText: vcr_03a attestation revocation and revocation checking the wallet provider of a given wua shall be the only party in the eudi wallet ecosystem responsible for executing the revocation of that wua. a wallet provider may outsource the operation of the revocation process to a third party.

VCR_04.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider that revoked a PID, attestation, or WUA SHALL NOT reverse the revocation.
VCR_04.searchText: vcr_04 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider that revoked a pid, attestation, or wua shall not reverse the revocation.

VCR_05.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL have a policy specifying under which conditions a PID, attestation, or WUA it issued will be revoked.
VCR_05.searchText: vcr_05 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall have a policy specifying under which conditions a pid, attestation, or wua it issued will be revoked.

VCR_06.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA when its security has been compromised.
VCR_06.searchText: vcr_06 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua when its security has been compromised.

VCR_07.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL revoke all valid WUAs issued to a Wallet Unit upon the explicit request of the User to revoke their Wallet Unit.
VCR_07.searchText: vcr_07 attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet provider shall revoke all valid wuas issued to a wallet unit upon the explicit request of the user to revoke their wallet unit.

VCR_07a.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID or attestation upon the explicit request of the User to whom the PID or the attestation was issued.
VCR_07a.searchText: vcr_07a attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid or attestation upon the explicit request of the user to whom the pid or the attestation was issued.

VCR_07b.specification: If a PID or attestation is revocable, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHOULD revoke that PID if the Wallet Unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement WURevocation_18 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).
VCR_07b.searchText: vcr_07b attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid or attestation is revocable, the pid provider or attestation provider should revoke that pid if the wallet unit on which it resides is revoked, in compliance with requirement wurevocation_18 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).

VCR_08.specification: If a PID is revocable, the PID Provider SHALL revoke a PID upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the PID, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the PID.
VCR_08.searchText: vcr_08 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid is revocable, the pid provider shall revoke a pid upon the death of the natural person who is the subject of the pid, or the cease of activity of the legal person who is the subject of the pid.

VCR_09.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA is revocable, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL revoke a PID, attestation, or WUA if the value of one or more attributes in the PID, attestation, or WUA was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. Subsequently, if the User's contact details are known, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHOULD, via an out-of-band manner, notify the User about the revocation and ask the User to request re-issuance of the PID, attestation, or WUA using their Wallet Unit.
VCR_09.notes: If the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the Provider, such as an Authentic Source, the Provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.
VCR_09.searchText: vcr_09 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a pid, attestation, or wua is revocable, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall revoke a pid, attestation, or wua if the value of one or more attributes in the pid, attestation, or wua was changed (including attributes being added or deleted) and it is still valid for at least 24 hours. subsequently, if the user's contact details are known, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider should, via an out-of-band manner, notify the user about the revocation and ask the user to request re-issuance of the pid, attestation, or wua using their wallet unit. if the value of the attributes is determined by a party different from the provider, such as an authentic source, the provider is responsible for ensuring that this third party notifies them about such changes.

VCR_10.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per VCR_11 in their Wallet Solutions.
VCR_10.searchText: vcr_10 attestation revocation and revocation checking wallet providers shall implement the attestation revocation mechanisms specified per vcr_11 in their wallet solutions.

VCR_11.specification: The Commission SHALL create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers to implement an Attestation Status List mechanism or an Attestation Revocation List mechanism for the PIDs, attestations, and WUAs they issue. These technical specifications SHALL also contain all details necessary for Relying Party Instances, Relying Parties, and Wallet Units interacting with other Wallet Units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of PIDs, attestations, and WUAs.
VCR_11.notes: 'Attestation Status List' and 'Attestation Revocation List' are specific mechanisms, defined in Annex 1. Attestation Revocation Lists are sometimes referred to as 'Identifier Lists'.
VCR_11.searchText: vcr_11 attestation revocation and revocation checking the commission shall create or reference technical specifications providing all necessary details for pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers to implement an attestation status list mechanism or an attestation revocation list mechanism for the pids, attestations, and wuas they issue. these technical specifications shall also contain all details necessary for relying party instances, relying parties, and wallet units interacting with other wallet units to use these mechanisms to verify the revocation status of pids, attestations, and wuas. 'attestation status list' and 'attestation revocation list' are specific mechanisms, defined in annex 1. attestation revocation lists are sometimes referred to as 'identifier lists'.

VCR_12.specification: If a Relying Party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of PIDs or attestations, it SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11.
VCR_12.notes: Per VCR_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a Relying Party to verify whether a PID or attestation is revoked.
VCR_12.searchText: vcr_12 attestation revocation and revocation checking if a relying party decides it needs to be able to verify the revocation status of pids or attestations, it shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11. per vcr_13, it is recommended but not mandatory for a relying party to verify whether a pid or attestation is revoked.

VCR_12a.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL support both the Attestation Status List mechanism and the Attestation Revocation List mechanism specified per VCR_11 for verifying the revocation status of a WUA.
VCR_12a.searchText: vcr_12a attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider or attestation provider shall support both the attestation status list mechanism and the attestation revocation list mechanism specified per vcr_11 for verifying the revocation status of a wua.

VCR_13.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD verify the revocation status of a PID or attestation upon obtaining it from a Wallet Unit, following the steps specified per VCR_11.
VCR_13.searchText: vcr_13 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should verify the revocation status of a pid or attestation upon obtaining it from a wallet unit, following the steps specified per vcr_11.

VCR_14.specification: When no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a PID or attestation is available, a Relying Party SHOULD perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the PID or attestation.
VCR_14.searchText: vcr_14 attestation revocation and revocation checking when no reliable information regarding the revocation status of a pid or attestation is available, a relying party should perform a risk analysis considering all relevant factors for the use case, before taking a decision to accept or refuse the pid or attestation.

VCR_15.specification: A Relying Party Instance SHOULD NOT request the relevant Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List each time an attestation is presented to it by a Wallet Unit. Rather, the Relying Party operating the Relying Party Instance SHOULD download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a PID or attestation by a User. The Relying Party SHOULD then distribute the list to all of its Relying Party Instances, using an Relying Party-internal distribution mechanism.
VCR_15.searchText: vcr_15 attestation revocation and revocation checking a relying party instance should not request the relevant attestation status list or attestation revocation list each time an attestation is presented to it by a wallet unit. rather, the relying party operating the relying party instance should download each new version of the list once, at a time and from a location unrelated to the presentation of a pid or attestation by a user. the relying party should then distribute the list to all of its relying party instances, using an relying party-internal distribution mechanism.

VCR_16.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL NOT require the Relying Party or Relying Party Instance to authenticate itself before downloading an Attestation Status List or Attestation Revocation List.
VCR_16.searchText: vcr_16 attestation revocation and revocation checking a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall not require the relying party or relying party instance to authenticate itself before downloading an attestation status list or attestation revocation list.

VCR_17.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL randomly assign the index for each PID or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator.
VCR_17.notes: Randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an Attestation Revocation List. This is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.
VCR_17.searchText: vcr_17 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall randomly assign the index for each pid or attestation, to prevent this index from becoming a correlator. randomly assigning indices within a bitstring or byte array is more complicated than creating random identifiers (e.g. serial numbers) for attestations, as is needed for an attestation revocation list. this is because duplicate indices and unnecessarily long bitstrings or byte arrays must be prevented.

VCR_18.specification: When using an Attestation Status List for revocation, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL represent a sufficiently large number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs on each Attestation Status List to ensure herd privacy.
VCR_18.notes: In this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider is not able to deduce which PID, attestation or WUA (likely) was presented to that entity. Complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs to be represented on the list is small. In such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced PIDs, attestations, or WUAs.
VCR_18.searchText: vcr_18 attestation revocation and revocation checking when using an attestation status list for revocation, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall represent a sufficiently large number of pids, attestations, or wuas on each attestation status list to ensure herd privacy. in this context, herd privacy means that if an entity requests a particular status list, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider is not able to deduce which pid, attestation or wua (likely) was presented to that entity. complying with this requirement may be difficult in case the number of pids, attestations, or wuas to be represented on the list is small. in such a case, decoy entries can be added to the list to obfuscate the real number of referenced pids, attestations, or wuas.

VCR_19.specification: A Wallet Unit SHOULD regularly check the revocation status of its PIDs, attestations, and WUAs, and notify the User if a PID, attestation, or WUA (i.e, the Wallet Unit itself), is revoked.
VCR_19.searchText: vcr_19 attestation revocation and revocation checking a wallet unit should regularly check the revocation status of its pids, attestations, and wuas, and notify the user if a pid, attestation, or wua (i.e, the wallet unit itself), is revoked.

WUA_01.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_01.specification: A WUA SHALL contain information about the capabilities of the WSCA/ WSCD of the Wallet Unit, such that a PID Provider or Attestation Provider is able to take a well-grounded decision on whether to issue a PID or attestation to the Wallet Unit.
WUA_01.searchText: wua_01 wallet unit attestation a wua shall contain information about the capabilities of the wsca/ wscd of the wallet unit, such that a pid provider or attestation provider is able to take a well-grounded decision on whether to issue a pid or attestation to the wallet unit.

WUA_02.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_02.specification: The WUA SHALL enable PID Providers and Attestation Providers to verify the authenticity and revocation status of the Wallet Unit.
WUA_02.searchText: wua_02 wallet unit attestation the wua shall enable pid providers and attestation providers to verify the authenticity and revocation status of the wallet unit.

WUA_03.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_03.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that a non-revoked Wallet Unit at all times can present a WUA, when requested by a PID Provider or Attestation Provider.
WUA_03.searchText: wua_03 wallet unit attestation a wallet provider shall ensure that a non-revoked wallet unit at all times can present a wua, when requested by a pid provider or attestation provider.

WUA_04.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases

WUA_05.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_05.specification: During issuance of a PID, the Wallet Unit SHALL request the WSCA/WSCD to generate a new key pair for the new PID. The Wallet Unit SHALL provide the PID Provider with a valid WUA describing the properties of the WSCA/WSCD that generated the new PID private key.
WUA_05.notes: A PID private key is always generated and managed by the WSCA/WSCD, which by definition complies with requirements for Level of Assurance High.
WUA_05.searchText: wua_05 wallet unit attestation during issuance of a pid, the wallet unit shall request the wsca/wscd to generate a new key pair for the new pid. the wallet unit shall provide the pid provider with a valid wua describing the properties of the wsca/wscd that generated the new pid private key. a pid private key is always generated and managed by the wsca/wscd, which by definition complies with requirements for level of assurance high.

WUA_05a.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_05a.specification: During issuance of a device-bound attestation, a Wallet Unit SHALL retrieve the requirements of the Attestation Provider regarding key storage from the Credential Issuer metadata (see ISSU_27). The Wallet Unit SHALL determine which of its WSCA/WSCD or keystore(s), if any, comply with these requirements. If a compliant WSCA/WSCD or keystore is available to the Wallet Unit, the Wallet Unit SHALL request it to generate a new key pair for the new attestation. The Wallet Unit SHALL provide the Attestation Provider with a valid WUA.
WUA_05a.notes: A WUA describes the properties of the WSCA/WSCD, not a keystore (see WUA_01) and contains a public key corresponding to a private key in the WSCA/WSCD, not in a keystore (WUA_09). If the Attestation Provider has a need for a key attestation of the new attestation key generated by a keystore, it can optionally use the mechanisms for key attestation as provided by the OS of the User's device.
WUA_05a.searchText: wua_05a wallet unit attestation during issuance of a device-bound attestation, a wallet unit shall retrieve the requirements of the attestation provider regarding key storage from the credential issuer metadata (see issu_27). the wallet unit shall determine which of its wsca/wscd or keystore(s), if any, comply with these requirements. if a compliant wsca/wscd or keystore is available to the wallet unit, the wallet unit shall request it to generate a new key pair for the new attestation. the wallet unit shall provide the attestation provider with a valid wua. a wua describes the properties of the wsca/wscd, not a keystore (see wua_01) and contains a public key corresponding to a private key in the wsca/wscd, not in a keystore (wua_09). if the attestation provider has a need for a key attestation of the new attestation key generated by a keystore, it can optionally use the mechanisms for key attestation as provided by the os of the user's device.

WUA_06.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_06.specification: If a Wallet Unit contains a WSCA/WSCD and one or more keystores, it SHALL, internally and securely, keep track of which PID(s) and attestation(s) are bound to which WSCA/WSCD or keystore.
WUA_06.searchText: wua_06 wallet unit attestation if a wallet unit contains a wsca/wscd and one or more keystores, it shall, internally and securely, keep track of which pid(s) and attestation(s) are bound to which wsca/wscd or keystore.

WUA_07.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_07.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL present a WUA only to a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, as part of the issuance process of a PID or an attestation.
WUA_07.searchText: wua_07 wallet unit attestation a wallet unit shall present a wua only to a pid provider or attestation provider, as part of the issuance process of a pid or an attestation.

WUA_08.subsection: A. Support for WUA Use Cases
WUA_08.specification: A WUA SHALL enable PID Providers to request a Wallet Provider to revoke a Wallet Unit, in accordance with requirement WURevocation_11, by including an identifier for the Wallet Unit in the WUA. The Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that this Wallet Unit identifier does not enable tracking of the User.
WUA_08.notes: a) This is a legal requirement from [CIR 2024/2977]. See also [Section 6.5.3.4 of the ARF main document](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#6534-wallet-provider-issues-one-or-more-wallet-unit-attestations-to-the-wallet-unit). b) The Wallet Unit identifier meant here can be the same as the one used for revoking the WUA, for instance a URI and index to an Attestation Status List (see [Topic 7](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a235-topic-7---attestation-revocation-and-revocation-checking)).
WUA_08.searchText: wua_08 wallet unit attestation a wua shall enable pid providers to request a wallet provider to revoke a wallet unit, in accordance with requirement wurevocation_11, by including an identifier for the wallet unit in the wua. the wallet provider shall ensure that this wallet unit identifier does not enable tracking of the user. a) this is a legal requirement from [cir 2024/2977]. see also [section 6.5.3.4 of the arf main document](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#6534-wallet-provider-issues-one-or-more-wallet-unit-attestations-to-the-wallet-unit). b) the wallet unit identifier meant here can be the same as the one used for revoking the wua, for instance a uri and index to an attestation status list (see [topic 7](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a235-topic-7---attestation-revocation-and-revocation-checking)).

WUA_09.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_09.specification: A WUA SHALL contain a public key, and the corresponding private key SHALL be generated by the WSCA/WSCD described in the WUA.
WUA_09.searchText: wua_09 wallet unit attestation a wua shall contain a public key, and the corresponding private key shall be generated by the wsca/wscd described in the wua.

WUA_10.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_10.searchText: wua_10 wallet unit attestation empty (moved to [topic 18](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2311-topic-18---combined-presentations-of-attributes))

WUA_11.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_11.specification: During PID or attestation issuance, the PID Provider SHALL verify that the WSCA/WSCD described in the WUA received from the Wallet Unit has proven possession of the private key corresponding to the public key in the WUA.
WUA_11.notes: This requirement also applies for the issuance of non-device bound attestations.
WUA_11.searchText: wua_11 wallet unit attestation during pid or attestation issuance, the pid provider shall verify that the wsca/wscd described in the wua received from the wallet unit has proven possession of the private key corresponding to the public key in the wua. this requirement also applies for the issuance of non-device bound attestations.

WUA_11a.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_11a.specification: During issuance of a PID or a device-bound attestation, the PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL verify that the WSCA/WSCD or a keystore has proven possession of the new PID or attestation private key.
WUA_11a.searchText: wua_11a wallet unit attestation during issuance of a pid or a device-bound attestation, the pid provider or attestation provider shall verify that the wsca/wscd or a keystore has proven possession of the new pid or attestation private key.

WUA_11b.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_11b.specification: During issuance of a PID, the PID Provider SHOULD verify a proof of cryptographic binding generated by the WSCA/WSCD per requirement ACP_01, if present, to verify that the new PID private key is managed by the same WSCA/WSCD as the WUA private key.
WUA_11b.notes: a) This requirement only applies to a PID, since the Wallet Unit can not provide this proof for an attestation bound to a keystore. b) The three proofs mentioned in WUA_11, WUA_11a and WUA_11b MAY be implemented as a single cryptographic proof.
WUA_11b.searchText: wua_11b wallet unit attestation during issuance of a pid, the pid provider should verify a proof of cryptographic binding generated by the wsca/wscd per requirement acp_01, if present, to verify that the new pid private key is managed by the same wsca/wscd as the wua private key. a) this requirement only applies to a pid, since the wallet unit can not provide this proof for an attestation bound to a keystore. b) the three proofs mentioned in wua_11, wua_11a and wua_11b may be implemented as a single cryptographic proof.

WUA_12.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_12.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL be able to prove that it possesses the private key corresponding to the public key in the WUA.
WUA_12.searchText: wua_12 wallet unit attestation the wallet unit shall be able to prove that it possesses the private key corresponding to the public key in the wua.

WUA_13.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys

WUA_14.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_14.searchText: wua_14 wallet unit attestation empty (moved to [topic 18](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2311-topic-18---combined-presentations-of-attributes))

WUA_15.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys

WUA_16.subsection: B. WUA in relation Cryptographic Keys
WUA_16.specification: If the WSCA/WSCD is able to export a private key, the Wallet Provider SHALL specify this capability as an attribute in the WUA.
WUA_16.searchText: wua_16 wallet unit attestation if the wsca/wscd is able to export a private key, the wallet provider shall specify this capability as an attribute in the wua.

WUA_17.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL consider all relevant factors, including offline usage, interoperability, and the risk of a WUA becoming a vector to track the User, when deciding on the validity period of a WUA.
WUA_17.notes: Regarding interoperability, see ISSU_12c, which limits the validity period of PIDs issued based on the validity period of the WUA
WUA_17.searchText: wua_17 wallet unit attestation a wallet provider shall consider all relevant factors, including offline usage, interoperability, and the risk of a wua becoming a vector to track the user, when deciding on the validity period of a wua. regarding interoperability, see issu_12c, which limits the validity period of pids issued based on the validity period of the wua

WUA_18.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL release a WUA only to a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, and not to a Relying Party or any other entity.
WUA_18.searchText: wua_18 wallet unit attestation a wallet unit shall release a wua only to a pid provider or attestation provider, and not to a relying party or any other entity.

WUA_20.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that its Wallet Units comply with all relevant requirements specified in [Technical Specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md).
WUA_20.searchText: wua_20 wallet unit attestation a wallet provider shall ensure that its wallet units comply with all relevant requirements specified in [technical specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md).

WUA_20a.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL comply with all relevant requirements specified in [Technical Specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md).
WUA_20a.searchText: wua_20a wallet unit attestation a pid provider or attestation provider shall comply with all relevant requirements specified in [technical specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md).

ISSU_01.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_01.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the OpenID4VCI protocol specified in [OpenID4VCI], as profiled by the 'OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance' profile specified in [HAIP], and with additions and changes as documented in this Annex (see e.g. this Topic and [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
ISSU_01.searchText: issu_01 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the openid4vci protocol specified in [openid4vci], as profiled by the 'openid for verifiable credential issuance' profile specified in [haip], and with additions and changes as documented in this annex (see e.g. this topic and [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

ISSU_01a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_01a.specification: PID Providers and Attestation Providers SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol specified in [OpenID4VCI], as profiled by the 'OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance' profile specified in [HAIP], and with additions and changes as documented in this Annex (see e.g. this Topic and [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
ISSU_01a.searchText: issu_01a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit pid providers and attestation providers shall support the openid4vci protocol specified in [openid4vci], as profiled by the 'openid for verifiable credential issuance' profile specified in [haip], and with additions and changes as documented in this annex (see e.g. this topic and [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

ISSU_02.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_02.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the attestation formats specified in ISO/IEC 18013-5, see [ISO18013-5], and in SD-JWT-based Verifiable Credentials (SD-JWT VC), see [SD-JWT-VC], with additions and changes as documented in this Annex and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
ISSU_02.searchText: issu_02 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the attestation formats specified in iso/iec 18013-5, see [iso18013-5], and in sd-jwt-based verifiable credentials (sd-jwt vc), see [sd-jwt-vc], with additions and changes as documented in this annex and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

ISSU_03.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_03.specification: Wallet Units, PID Providers, and Attestation Providers SHALL support the [W3C Digital Credentials API]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for the issuance of PIDs and attestations, provided that a) this API is a W3C Recommendation, b) this API complies with the expectations outlined in [Chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3)  of the Topic F discussion paper, and c) this API is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.
ISSU_03.searchText: issu_03 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet units, pid providers, and attestation providers shall support the [w3c digital credentials api]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for the issuance of pids and attestations, provided that a) this api is a w3c recommendation, b) this api complies with the expectations outlined in [chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3)  of the topic f discussion paper, and c) this api is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.

ISSU_04.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_04.specification: The OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable PID Providers and Attestation Provider to issue to a Wallet Unit a batch of multiple PIDs or attestations that are simultaneously valid and contain the same attributes.
ISSU_04.searchText: issu_04 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable pid providers and attestation provider to issue to a wallet unit a batch of multiple pids or attestations that are simultaneously valid and contain the same attributes.

ISSU_05.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_05.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support a process to activate a newly issued PID, in accordance with the requirements for LoA High in [Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32015R1502) Section 2.2.2. The Wallet Unit SHALL NOT allow a User to use a non-activated PID.
ISSU_05.notes: a) The goal of the activation process is to verify that the PID was delivered into the Wallet Unit and WSCA/WSCD of the User who is the subject of the PID. b) This requirement is not applicable for QEAAs, PuB-EAAs or non-qualified EAAs, since these are not identity means in the sense of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.
ISSU_05.searchText: issu_05 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support a process to activate a newly issued pid, in accordance with the requirements for loa high in [commission implementing regulation (eu) 2015/1502](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=celex%3a32015r1502) section 2.2.2. the wallet unit shall not allow a user to use a non-activated pid. a) the goal of the activation process is to verify that the pid was delivered into the wallet unit and wsca/wscd of the user who is the subject of the pid. b) this requirement is not applicable for qeaas, pub-eaas or non-qualified eaas, since these are not identity means in the sense of commission implementing regulation (eu) 2015/1502.

ISSU_06.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_06.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PID or an attestation from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, it SHALL verify that the PID or attestation it received matches the PID or attestation requested by the Wallet Unit.
ISSU_06.searchText: issu_06 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pid or an attestation from a pid provider or attestation provider, it shall verify that the pid or attestation it received matches the pid or attestation requested by the wallet unit.

ISSU_07.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_07.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PID from a PID Provider, it SHALL validate the signature of the PID using a trust anchor provided in a PID Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates), unless this would result in the validation of the PID signature being done by the same component that created the signature.
ISSU_07.notes: This could be the case in architectures where the Wallet Provider is also the PID Provider and the Wallet Units use a remote HSM as their WSCD.
ISSU_07.searchText: issu_07 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pid from a pid provider, it shall validate the signature of the pid using a trust anchor provided in a pid provider trusted list made available in accordance with [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)], unless this would result in the validation of the pid signature being done by the same component that created the signature. this could be the case in architectures where the wallet provider is also the pid provider and the wallet units use a remote hsm as their wscd.

ISSU_08.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_08.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a QEAA from a QEAA Provider, it SHALL validate the qualified signature of the QEAA in accordance with Art.32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For the verification, the Wallet Unit SHALL use a trust anchor provided in a QEAA Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation].
ISSU_08.searchText: issu_08 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a qeaa from a qeaa provider, it shall validate the qualified signature of the qeaa in accordance with art.32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for the verification, the wallet unit shall use a trust anchor provided in a qeaa provider trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation].

ISSU_09.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_09.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PuB-EAA from a PUB-EAA Provider, it SHALL validate the qualified signature of the PuB-EAA in accordance with Art. 32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For that verification, the Wallet Unit SHALL use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the QTSP supporting the qualified signature. The Wallet Unit SHALL also validate the qualified certificate of the QTSP using a trust anchor provided in a Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. Finally, the Wallet Unit SHALL also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [Article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e3902-1-1).
ISSU_09.searchText: issu_09 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pub-eaa from a pub-eaa provider, it shall validate the qualified signature of the pub-eaa in accordance with art. 32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for that verification, the wallet unit shall use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the qtsp supporting the qualified signature. the wallet unit shall also validate the qualified certificate of the qtsp using a trust anchor provided in a trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. finally, the wallet unit shall also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e3902-1-1).

ISSU_10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a non-qualified EAA from an EAA Provider, it SHALL validate the signature of the EAA using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable Rulebook, see [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
ISSU_10.notes: a) Requirements ISSU_07 to ISSU_10 are equivalent to requirements OIA_12 to OIA_15 in [Topic 1](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a231-topic-1---accessing-online-services-with-a-wallet-unit). b) These requirements imply that a Wallet Instance must be aware whether the attestation it is requesting from an issuer is a PID, a QEAA, a PuB-EAA, or a non-qualified EAA. These requirements also imply that the Wallet Unit must store trust anchors in such a way that, when it receives an issued attestation, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for PIDs, for QEAAs, for PuB-EAAs, or for non-qualified EAAs. c) PID Providers, QEAA Providers, and PuB-EAA Providers are trusted by other actors in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or PIDs) that they are not legally allowed to issue. This trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. However, non-qualified EAA Providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. Therefore, before requesting an non-qualified attestation, a Wallet Unit may need to verify that the non-qualified EAA Provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation. Mechanisms allowing to do this may be defined in the applicable Rulebook, see ARB_26.
ISSU_10.searchText: issu_10 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a non-qualified eaa from an eaa provider, it shall validate the signature of the eaa using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. a) requirements issu_07 to issu_10 are equivalent to requirements oia_12 to oia_15 in [topic 1](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a231-topic-1---accessing-online-services-with-a-wallet-unit). b) these requirements imply that a wallet instance must be aware whether the attestation it is requesting from an issuer is a pid, a qeaa, a pub-eaa, or a non-qualified eaa. these requirements also imply that the wallet unit must store trust anchors in such a way that, when it receives an issued attestation, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for pids, for qeaas, for pub-eaas, or for non-qualified eaas. c) pid providers, qeaa providers, and pub-eaa providers are trusted by other actors in the eudi wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or pids) that they are not legally allowed to issue. this trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. however, non-qualified eaa providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. therefore, before requesting an non-qualified attestation, a wallet unit may need to verify that the non-qualified eaa provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation. mechanisms allowing to do this may be defined in the applicable rulebook, see arb_26.

ISSU_11.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_11.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL request the User's approval before storing a PID or attestation obtained from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider. When requesting approval, the Wallet Instance SHALL display the contents of the PID or attestation to the User. The Wallet Instance SHALL also inform the User about the identity of the PID Provider or Attestation Provider, using the subject information in the PID Provider's or Attestation Provider's access certificate.
ISSU_11.searchText: issu_11 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall request the user's approval before storing a pid or attestation obtained from a pid provider or attestation provider. when requesting approval, the wallet instance shall display the contents of the pid or attestation to the user. the wallet instance shall also inform the user about the identity of the pid provider or attestation provider, using the subject information in the pid provider's or attestation provider's access certificate.

ISSU_11b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_11b.specification: In case one or more of the verifications in ISSU_06 - ISSU_11 fail, the Wallet Unit SHALL immediately delete the PID or attestation it received. The Wallet Instance SHALL notify the User about the fact that issuance of the PID or attestation was not successful, including the reason for this failure.
ISSU_11b.searchText: issu_11b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit in case one or more of the verifications in issu_06 - issu_11 fail, the wallet unit shall immediately delete the pid or attestation it received. the wallet instance shall notify the user about the fact that issuance of the pid or attestation was not successful, including the reason for this failure.

ISSU_12.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_12.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL offer its PIDs or attestations in all formats required in the PID Rulebook or the applicable Attestation Rulebook, see [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
ISSU_12.notes: Examples include the mdoc format specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and the SD-JWT VC-format specified in [SD-JWT VC].
ISSU_12.searchText: issu_12 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider or attestation provider shall offer its pids or attestations in all formats required in the pid rulebook or the applicable attestation rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. examples include the mdoc format specified in [iso/iec 18013-5] and the sd-jwt vc-format specified in [sd-jwt vc].

ISSU_12a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_12a.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that, when a User instructs their Wallet Unit to request a PID or attestation from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, the Wallet Unit requests that PID or attestation in all formats offered by the PID Provider or Attestation Provider.
ISSU_12a.notes: Examples include the mdoc format specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and the SD-JWT VC-format specified in [SD-JWT VC].
