ISSU_12a.searchText: issu_12a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that, when a user instructs their wallet unit to request a pid or attestation from a pid provider or attestation provider, the wallet unit requests that pid or attestation in all formats offered by the pid provider or attestation provider. examples include the mdoc format specified in [iso/iec 18013-5] and the sd-jwt vc-format specified in [sd-jwt vc].

ISSU_12b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_12b.specification: During issuance of a PID or a device-bound attestation, the WSCA/WSCD or a key store SHALL generate a new key pair for a new PID or attestation, on request of the PID Provider or Attestation Provider via the Wallet Instance.
ISSU_12b.notes: See also WUA_05. In case of synchronous issuing in a remote HSM architecture, re-use of an existing key pair for the new PID or attestation may be acceptable and it may not be necessary to generate a new key pair for each new PID or attestation.
ISSU_12b.searchText: issu_12b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit during issuance of a pid or a device-bound attestation, the wsca/wscd or a key store shall generate a new key pair for a new pid or attestation, on request of the pid provider or attestation provider via the wallet instance. see also wua_05. in case of synchronous issuing in a remote hsm architecture, re-use of an existing key pair for the new pid or attestation may be acceptable and it may not be necessary to generate a new key pair for each new pid or attestation.

ISSU_12c.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_12c.specification: The expiration date of a PID SHALL be no later than the expiration date of the WUA presented as part of the PID issuance process.
ISSU_12c.notes: This requirement is an implication of WURevocation_18 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). If the PID would be valid for longer than the WUA, the PID Provider would not be able to use the revocation information in the WUA to verify the revocation status of the Wallet Unit.
ISSU_12c.searchText: issu_12c issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the expiration date of a pid shall be no later than the expiration date of the wua presented as part of the pid issuance process. this requirement is an implication of wurevocation_18 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). if the pid would be valid for longer than the wua, the pid provider would not be able to use the revocation information in the wua to verify the revocation status of the wallet unit.

ISSU_12d.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_12d.specification: If an Attestation Provider supports revocation chaining for its attestations per WURevocation_19 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation), the expiration date of an attestation SHALL be no later than the expiration date of the WUA presented as part of the attestation issuance process.
ISSU_12d.searchText: issu_12d issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if an attestation provider supports revocation chaining for its attestations per wurevocation_19 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation), the expiration date of an attestation shall be no later than the expiration date of the wua presented as part of the attestation issuance process. see note in issu_12c.

ISSU_13.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_13.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that at least one PID Provider is willing to issue a PID complying with [PID Rulebook] to Users of the Wallet Units it provides.
ISSU_13.searchText: issu_13 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that at least one pid provider is willing to issue a pid complying with [pid rulebook] to users of the wallet units it provides.

ISSU_14.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_14.specification: A PID Provider SHALL ensure that all PIDs it issues to Wallet Units comply with the requirements specified in [PID Rulebook].
ISSU_14.searchText: issu_14 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall ensure that all pids it issues to wallet units comply with the requirements specified in [pid rulebook].

ISSU_15.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_15.specification: A PID Provider SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01 for issuing PIDs.
ISSU_15.searchText: issu_15 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall support the openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01 for issuing pids.

ISSU_16.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_16.searchText: issu_16 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit empty

ISSU_17.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_17.specification: A PID Provider SHALL implement device binding for all PIDs it issues, meaning it SHALL ensure that a PID is cryptographically bound to the WSCA/WSCD included in the Wallet Unit, as specified in requirements WUA_11 - WUA_11b in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation).
ISSU_17.notes: Device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT-VC].
ISSU_17.searchText: issu_17 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall implement device binding for all pids it issues, meaning it shall ensure that a pid is cryptographically bound to the wsca/wscd included in the wallet unit, as specified in requirements wua_11 - wua_11b in [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]. device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [iso/iec 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [sd-jwt-vc].

ISSU_18.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_18.specification: A PID Provider SHALL verify the identity of the subject of the PID in compliance with Level of Assurance (LoA) High requirements.
ISSU_18.notes: These requirements will be determined by the relevant eID scheme.
ISSU_18.searchText: issu_18 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall verify the identity of the subject of the pid in compliance with level of assurance (loa) high requirements. these requirements will be determined by the relevant eid scheme.

ISSU_18a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_18a.specification: A PID Provider SHALL ensure that the attributes attested in the PID issued are valid for the identified PID subject at any point of time of PID validity.
ISSU_18a.searchText: issu_18a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall ensure that the attributes attested in the pid issued are valid for the identified pid subject at any point of time of pid validity.

ISSU_19.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_19.specification: For the verification of a WUA, a PID Provider SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Wallet Provider Trusted List it needs.
ISSU_19.notes: a) The Wallet Provider Trusted List is explained in [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates). b) It is not mandatory for a PID Provider to accept all Wallet Provider Trusted Lists, if there are multiple. This is because it is not mandatory for a PID Provider to accept all certified Wallet Solutions in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem. Each PID Provider will choose which Trusted Lists they need to subscribe to.
ISSU_19.searchText: issu_19 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of a wua, a pid provider shall accept the trust anchors in the wallet provider trusted list it needs. a) the wallet provider trusted list is explained in [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)]. b) it is not mandatory for a pid provider to accept all wallet provider trusted lists, if there are multiple. this is because it is not mandatory for a pid provider to accept all certified wallet solutions in the eudi wallet ecosystem. each pid provider will choose which trusted lists they need to subscribe to.

ISSU_19a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_19a.specification: A PID Provider SHALL support at least one Wallet Solution, meaning that it is willing and able to issue a PID to a Wallet Unit on request of the User.
ISSU_19a.searchText: issu_19a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall support at least one wallet solution, meaning that it is willing and able to issue a pid to a wallet unit on request of the user.

ISSU_20.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_20.specification: To inform its potential PID subjects about the Wallet Solution(s) they can use for requesting a PID, a PID Provider SHALL publish a list of supported Wallet Solutions in such a way that it can be easily found, for example on the PID Provider's website.
ISSU_20.searchText: issu_20 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit to inform its potential pid subjects about the wallet solution(s) they can use for requesting a pid, a pid provider shall publish a list of supported wallet solutions in such a way that it can be easily found, for example on the pid provider's website.

ISSU_21.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_21.specification: Before issuing a PID, a PID Provider SHALL verify that the Wallet Provider mentioned in the Wallet Unit's WUA is present in a Wallet Provider Trusted List. The PID Provider SHALL also authenticate and validate the WUA using the trust anchor(s) registered for the Wallet Provider in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. Moreover, it SHALL verify that the Wallet Units's WUA is not revoked.
ISSU_21.notes: a) For the WUA, see [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation) and [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). b) [CIR 2024/2977](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32024R2977), Article 3 (9), also allows another authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme notified at assurance level high. However, the ARF does not further specify such other authentication mechanisms, which means that in general they will not be interoperable.
ISSU_21.searchText: issu_21 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before issuing a pid, a pid provider shall verify that the wallet provider mentioned in the wallet unit's wua is present in a wallet provider trusted list. the pid provider shall also authenticate and validate the wua using the trust anchor(s) registered for the wallet provider in the wallet provider trusted list. moreover, it shall verify that the wallet units's wua is not revoked. a) for the wua, see [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)] and [[topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation)]. b) [cir 2024/2977](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=celex:32024r2977), article 3 (9), also allows another authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme notified at assurance level high. however, the arf does not further specify such other authentication mechanisms, which means that in general they will not be interoperable.

ISSU_22.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_22.specification: A PID Provider SHALL include its PID Provider access certificate in its Issuer metadata used in the common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01.
ISSU_22.searchText: issu_22 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall include its pid provider access certificate in its issuer metadata used in the common openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01.

ISSU_22a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_22a.specification: A PID Provider SHALL sign its metadata (as defined in OpenID4VCI) using the private key corresponding to its PID Provider access certificate.
ISSU_22a.searchText: issu_22a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall sign its metadata (as defined in openid4vci) using the private key corresponding to its pid provider access certificate.

ISSU_22b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_22b.specification: The common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable a PID Provider or Attestation Provider to include its access certificate and registration certificate in its Issuer metadata, according to requirement ISSU_22 and RPRC_22, respectively.
ISSU_22b.searchText: issu_22b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the common openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable a pid provider or attestation provider to include its access certificate and registration certificate in its issuer metadata, according to requirement issu_22 and rprc_22, respectively.

ISSU_23.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_23.specification: For the verification of PID Provider access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Trusted List(s) of Access Certificate Authorities it needs.
ISSU_23.notes: a) Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists are explained in [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties). b) It is not mandatory for a Wallet Unit to accept all Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists for PID Providers, if there are multiple. Wallet Providers will choose which of these Trusted Lists they need to subscribe to, for example depending on the Member State(s) they are operating in.
ISSU_23.searchText: issu_23 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of pid provider access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in the trusted list(s) of access certificate authorities it needs. a) access certificate authority trusted lists are explained in [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)]. b) it is not mandatory for a wallet unit to accept all access certificate authority trusted lists for pid providers, if there are multiple. wallet providers will choose which of these trusted lists they need to subscribe to, for example depending on the member state(s) they are operating in.

ISSU_23a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_23a.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL support at least one PID Provider, meaning that its Wallet Units SHALL be capable of requesting the issuance of a PID from these PID Provider(s), and that the Wallet Provider has agreed with the PID Provider(s) that the PID Provider(s) will process such a request according to the agreed rules and procedures.
ISSU_23a.searchText: issu_23a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall support at least one pid provider, meaning that its wallet units shall be capable of requesting the issuance of a pid from these pid provider(s), and that the wallet provider has agreed with the pid provider(s) that the pid provider(s) will process such a request according to the agreed rules and procedures.

ISSU_23b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_23b.specification: Prior to or during installation of a Wallet Instance, the Wallet Provider SHALL notify the User about the PID Provider(s) that are supported by the Wallet Unit.
ISSU_23b.searchText: issu_23b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit prior to or during installation of a wallet instance, the wallet provider shall notify the user about the pid provider(s) that are supported by the wallet unit.

ISSU_24.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_24.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate and validate the PID Provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of a PID. The Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a CA that is in a Access Certificate Authority Trusted List.
ISSU_24.searchText: issu_24 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall authenticate and validate the pid provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of a pid. the wallet unit shall verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a ca that is in a access certificate authority trusted list.

ISSU_24a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_24a.specification: Before requesting the issuance of a PID, the Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the PID Provider is indeed a registered PID Provider. The Wallet Unit SHALL do so using information contained in the PID Provider registration certificate, if available in the Credential Issuer metadata of the PID Provider. If the registration certificate is not available, the Wallet Unit SHALL use the URL of the Registrar's online service, contained in the Credential Issuer metadata, to obtain the necessary information from the Registrar. If the registered information does not confirm that the PID Provider is indeed registered as a PID Provider, the Wallet Unit SHALL display a warning to the User, and SHALL NOT request the issuance of a PID.
ISSU_24a.searchText: issu_24a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before requesting the issuance of a pid, the wallet unit shall verify that the pid provider is indeed a registered pid provider. the wallet unit shall do so using information contained in the pid provider registration certificate, if available in the credential issuer metadata of the pid provider. if the registration certificate is not available, the wallet unit shall use the url of the registrar's online service, contained in the credential issuer metadata, to obtain the necessary information from the registrar. if the registered information does not confirm that the pid provider is indeed registered as a pid provider, the wallet unit shall display a warning to the user, and shall not request the issuance of a pid.

ISSU_25.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_25.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL ensure all attestations issued to Wallet Units comply with the requirements specified in the applicable Rulebook, as described in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
ISSU_25.searchText: issu_25 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider shall ensure all attestations issued to wallet units comply with the requirements specified in the applicable rulebook, as described in [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)].

ISSU_26.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_26.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01 for issuing attestations.
ISSU_26.searchText: issu_26 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider shall support the openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01 for issuing attestations.

ISSU_27.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_27.specification: An Attestation Provider SHOULD implement device binding for all attestations it issues. If an issued attestation is device-bound, the Attestation Provider SHALL ensure that the attestation is cryptographically bound to a WSCA/WSCD or a keystore available to the Wallet Unit, as specified in requirement WUA_11 - WUA_11b in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation).
ISSU_27.notes: a) Device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT-VC]. b) Implementing mdoc authentication is mandatory in [ISO/IEC 18013-5]
ISSU_27.searchText: issu_27 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider should implement device binding for all attestations it issues. if an issued attestation is device-bound, the attestation provider shall ensure that the attestation is cryptographically bound to a wsca/wscd or a keystore available to the wallet unit, as specified in requirement wua_11 - wua_11b in [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]. a) device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [iso/iec 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [sd-jwt-vc]. b) implementing mdoc authentication is mandatory in [iso/iec 18013-5]

ISSU_27a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_27a.specification: If the subject of the attestation is a natural person, an Attestation Provider SHALL verify the identity of the subject of the attestation, in compliance with applicable requirements and in accordance with relevant standards or Implementing Regulations.
ISSU_27a.notes: Not every attestation has a natural person as its subject. For example, a holiday voucher may be valid for any User that can present it to a Relying Party and therefore has no subject. This is comparable to the concept of a 'bearer token'.
ISSU_27a.searchText: issu_27a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if the subject of the attestation is a natural person, an attestation provider shall verify the identity of the subject of the attestation, in compliance with applicable requirements and in accordance with relevant standards or implementing regulations. not every attestation has a natural person as its subject. for example, a holiday voucher may be valid for any user that can present it to a relying party and therefore has no subject. this is comparable to the concept of a 'bearer token'.

ISSU_27b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_27b.specification: If applicable, an Attestation Provider SHALL ensure that the attributes attested in the attestation issued are valid for the identified attestation subject.
ISSU_27b.searchText: issu_27b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if applicable, an attestation provider shall ensure that the attributes attested in the attestation issued are valid for the identified attestation subject.

ISSU_27c.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_27c.specification: The Attestation Provider SHALL verify that the User requesting the attestation has the right to receive it.
ISSU_27c.searchText: issu_27c issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the attestation provider shall verify that the user requesting the attestation has the right to receive it.

ISSU_28.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_28.specification: For the verification of a WUA, an Attestation Provider SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Wallet Provider Trusted List.
ISSU_28.notes: The Wallet Provider Trusted List is explained in [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates).
ISSU_28.searchText: issu_28 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of a wua, an attestation provider shall accept the trust anchors in the wallet provider trusted list. the wallet provider trusted list is explained in [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)].

ISSU_29.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_29.specification: A QEAA Provider or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL support all Wallet Solutions, except in case the attestation in question is a Strong User Authentication (SUA) attestation as meant in [Topic 20](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the Wallet Provider does not support processing of the transactional data associated with the SUA attestation. Except for such cases, A QEAA Provider or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL NOT discriminate between Wallet Solutions when processing a request for the issuance of an attestation.
ISSU_29.notes: This requirement is not applicable for non-qualified EAA Providers. For example, a non-qualified EAA Provider may choose to issue attestations in the format specified in [W3C VCDM], see ARB_01a. In that case, it will support only those Wallet Solutions that have implemented this attestation format.
ISSU_29.searchText: issu_29 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a qeaa provider or pub-eaa provider shall support all wallet solutions, except in case the attestation in question is a strong user authentication (sua) attestation as meant in [topic 20](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the wallet provider does not support processing of the transactional data associated with the sua attestation. except for such cases, a qeaa provider or pub-eaa provider shall not discriminate between wallet solutions when processing a request for the issuance of an attestation. this requirement is not applicable for non-qualified eaa providers. for example, a non-qualified eaa provider may choose to issue attestations in the format specified in [w3c vcdm], see arb_01a. in that case, it will support only those wallet solutions that have implemented this attestation format.

ISSU_30.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_30.specification: Before issuing an attestation, an Attestation Provider SHALL: - verify that the Wallet Provider mentioned in the Wallet Unit's WUA is present in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. - authenticate and validate the WUA using the trust anchor(s) registered for the Wallet Provider in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. - verify that the Wallet Unit's WUA is not revoked.
ISSU_30.searchText: issu_30 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before issuing an attestation, an attestation provider shall: - verify that the wallet provider mentioned in the wallet unit's wua is present in the wallet provider trusted list. - authenticate and validate the wua using the trust anchor(s) registered for the wallet provider in the wallet provider trusted list. - verify that the wallet unit's wua is not revoked. for the wua, see [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)] and [[topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation)].

ISSU_31.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_31.searchText: issu_31 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit empty

ISSU_32.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_32.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL include its Attestation Provider access certificate and registration certificate(s) in its Issuer metadata used in the common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01.
ISSU_32.searchText: issu_32 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider shall include its attestation provider access certificate and registration certificate(s) in its issuer metadata used in the common openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01.

ISSU_32a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_32a.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL sign its metadata (as defined in OpenID4VCI) using the private key corresponding to its Attestation Provider access certificate.
ISSU_32a.searchText: issu_32a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider shall sign its metadata (as defined in openid4vci) using the private key corresponding to its attestation provider access certificate.

ISSU_33.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_33.specification: For the verification of Attestation Provider access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in all applicable Access Certificate Authority Trusted List(s).
ISSU_33.notes: Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists are explained in [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties). There may be separate Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists for QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and EAA Providers.
ISSU_33.searchText: issu_33 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of attestation provider access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in all applicable access certificate authority trusted list(s). access certificate authority trusted lists are explained in [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)]. there may be separate access certificate authority trusted lists for qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and eaa providers.

ISSU_33a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_33a.specification: For the verification of Attestation Provider registration certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in all Trusted List(s) for Providers of registration certificates.
ISSU_33a.searchText: issu_33a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of attestation provider registration certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in all trusted list(s) for providers of registration certificates.

ISSU_33b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_33b.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL support all Attestation Providers, except possibly if the attestation in question is a Strong User Authentication (SUA) attestation as meant in [Topic 20](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the Wallet Provider chooses to not support processing of the transactional data associated with that attestation. Except for such cases, Wallet Units SHALL be capable of requesting the issuance of a QEAA, PuB-EAA, or non-qualified EAA from all Attestation Providers at the User's request.
ISSU_33b.searchText: issu_33b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall support all attestation providers, except possibly if the attestation in question is a strong user authentication (sua) attestation as meant in [topic 20](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the wallet provider chooses to not support processing of the transactional data associated with that attestation. except for such cases, wallet units shall be capable of requesting the issuance of a qeaa, pub-eaa, or non-qualified eaa from all attestation providers at the user's request.

ISSU_34.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_34.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate and validate the Attestation Provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of an attestation. The Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a CA that is in an Access Certificate Authority Trusted List, as documented in [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties).
ISSU_34.searchText: issu_34 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall authenticate and validate the attestation provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of an attestation. the wallet unit shall verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a ca that is in an access certificate authority trusted list, as documented in [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)].

ISSU_34a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_34a.specification: Before requesting the issuance of an attestation, the Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the Attestation Provider is a registered QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, or EAA Provider. The Wallet Unit SHALL also verify the Provider's sub-entitlements, i.e., whether the Provider properly registered for the issuance of the type of attestation that the User wants to obtain. The Wallet Unit SHALL do these checks using information contained in the Attestation Provider registration certificate, if available in the Credential Issuer metadata of the Attestation Provider. If the registration certificate is not available, the Wallet Unit SHALL use the URL of the Registrar's online service, contained in the Credential Issuer metadata, to obtain such information. If the registered information does not confirm that the Attestation Provider is indeed registered as a QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, or EAA Provider, or if the registered information does not confirm that the Attestation Provider registered for the relevant type of attestation, the Wallet Unit SHALL display a warning to the User, and SHALL NOT request the issuance of an attestation.
ISSU_34a.searchText: issu_34a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before requesting the issuance of an attestation, the wallet unit shall verify that the attestation provider is a registered qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, or eaa provider. the wallet unit shall also verify the provider's sub-entitlements, i.e., whether the provider properly registered for the issuance of the type of attestation that the user wants to obtain. the wallet unit shall do these checks using information contained in the attestation provider registration certificate, if available in the credential issuer metadata of the attestation provider. if the registration certificate is not available, the wallet unit shall use the url of the registrar's online service, contained in the credential issuer metadata, to obtain such information. if the registered information does not confirm that the attestation provider is indeed registered as a qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, or eaa provider, or if the registered information does not confirm that the attestation provider registered for the relevant type of attestation, the wallet unit shall display a warning to the user, and shall not request the issuance of an attestation.

ISSU_35.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_35.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_35.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL ensure that all unique elements in a PID or attestation have a negligible chance of having the same value across all PIDs or attestations issued by that Provider. This SHALL include at least a) the salt used for hashing every attribute, b) the hash values of all attributes, c) the attestation identifier or index used for revocation purposes (if applicable), d) the attestation public key used for device binding (if applicable), and e) the value of the Attestation Provider signature.
ISSU_35.notes: a) The list of unique elements is based on [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and [SD-JWT VC]. b) This requirement can be achieved, for example, by ensuring that salt values, indexes and attestation identifiers are pseudo-random numbers generated by a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (CSPRNG).
ISSU_35.searchText: issu_35 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider or attestation provider shall ensure that all unique elements in a pid or attestation have a negligible chance of having the same value across all pids or attestations issued by that provider. this shall include at least a) the salt used for hashing every attribute, b) the hash values of all attributes, c) the attestation identifier or index used for revocation purposes (if applicable), d) the attestation public key used for device binding (if applicable), and e) the value of the attestation provider signature. a) the list of unique elements is based on [iso/iec 18013-5] and [sd-jwt vc]. b) this requirement can be achieved, for example, by ensuring that salt values, indexes and attestation identifiers are pseudo-random numbers generated by a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (csprng).

ISSU_35a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_35a.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_35a.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that all unique elements in a WUA have a negligible chance of having the same value across all WUAs issued by that Wallet Provider. This SHALL include at least a) the attestation identifier or index used for revocation purposes, b) the WUA public key used for device binding, and c) the value of the Wallet Provider signature.
ISSU_35a.notes: a) The list of unique elements is based on [Technical Specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md). b) This requirement can be achieved, for example, by ensuring that indexes are pseudo-random numbers generated by a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (CSPRNG).
ISSU_35a.searchText: issu_35a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that all unique elements in a wua have a negligible chance of having the same value across all wuas issued by that wallet provider. this shall include at least a) the attestation identifier or index used for revocation purposes, b) the wua public key used for device binding, and c) the value of the wallet provider signature. a) the list of unique elements is based on [technical specification 3](../../technical-specifications/ts3-wallet-unit-attestation.md). b) this requirement can be achieved, for example, by ensuring that indexes are pseudo-random numbers generated by a cryptographically secure pseudo-random number generator (csprng).

ISSU_35b.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_35b.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_35b.specification: After issuing a PID, attestation, or WUA, a PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement ISSU_35 or ISSU_35a (as applicable) above, as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. The Provider SHALL NOT communicate these values to any other party inside or outside the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
ISSU_35b.searchText: issu_35b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after issuing a pid, attestation, or wua, a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall discard the values of all unique elements, including at least the ones mentioned in requirement issu_35 or issu_35a (as applicable) above, as well as any timestamps, as soon as they are no longer needed. the provider shall not communicate these values to any other party inside or outside the eudi wallet ecosystem.

ISSU_36.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_36.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_36.specification: When issuing PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in a batch to a Wallet Unit, a PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that the timestamps in these PIDs, attestations, or WUAs do not enable Relying Parties to conclude that they are part of the same batch (and therefore belong to the same User).
ISSU_36.notes: This can be done, for example, by making timestamps sufficiently imprecise that a high number of batches, each issued to a different Wallet Unit, share the same timestamp values (herd privacy).
ISSU_36.searchText: issu_36 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit when issuing pids, attestations, or wuas in a batch to a wallet unit, a pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall ensure that the timestamps in these pids, attestations, or wuas do not enable relying parties to conclude that they are part of the same batch (and therefore belong to the same user). this can be done, for example, by making timestamps sufficiently imprecise that a high number of batches, each issued to a different wallet unit, share the same timestamp values (herd privacy).

ISSU_37.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_37.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_37.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that its Wallet Solution supports the following methods for limiting the number of times a User can present the same PID or attestation to Relying Parties: Method A (Once-only attestations, as specified in requirement ISSU_43 - ISSU_47) and Method B (Limited-time attestations, as specified in requirement ISSU_48 - ISSU_50). In addition, a Wallet Provider MAY ensure that its Wallet Solution supports Method C (Rotating-batch attestations, as specified in requirement ISSU_51 - ISSU_54) or Method D (Per-Relying Party attestations, as specified in requirement ISSU_55 - ISSU_57).
ISSU_37.notes: Wallet Solutions, PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers are free to define and use other methods as well. However, such other methods are out of scope of the ARF.
ISSU_37.searchText: issu_37 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that its wallet solution supports the following methods for limiting the number of times a user can present the same pid or attestation to relying parties: method a (once-only attestations, as specified in requirement issu_43 - issu_47) and method b (limited-time attestations, as specified in requirement issu_48 - issu_50). in addition, a wallet provider may ensure that its wallet solution supports method c (rotating-batch attestations, as specified in requirement issu_51 - issu_54) or method d (per-relying party attestations, as specified in requirement issu_55 - issu_57). wallet solutions, pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers are free to define and use other methods as well. however, such other methods are out of scope of the arf.

ISSU_38.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_38.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_38.specification: A PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL have a policy describing which of the methods A, B, C, or D, it will use to limit the number of times a Wallet Unit may present a single PID, attestation, or WUA. For each supported method, the policy SHALL also specify how the values for respective parameters for that method, such as technical validity period and batch size, will be chosen. The goal of the policy SHALL be to ensure that the risk of linkability is mitigated to an acceptable level, given the (expected) usage of the PID, attestation, or WUA by the User. To determine what an acceptable level of risk is, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL carry out a risk analysis regarding linkability.
ISSU_38.notes: If an Attestation Provider issues multiple attestation types, these requirements apply for each type of attestation separately.
ISSU_38.searchText: issu_38 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall have a policy describing which of the methods a, b, c, or d, it will use to limit the number of times a wallet unit may present a single pid, attestation, or wua. for each supported method, the policy shall also specify how the values for respective parameters for that method, such as technical validity period and batch size, will be chosen. the goal of the policy shall be to ensure that the risk of linkability is mitigated to an acceptable level, given the (expected) usage of the pid, attestation, or wua by the user. to determine what an acceptable level of risk is, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall carry out a risk analysis regarding linkability. if an attestation provider issues multiple attestation types, these requirements apply for each type of attestation separately.

ISSU_39.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_39.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_39.specification: The Commission SHALL create or reference a profile or extension of the OpenID4VCI specification enabling a PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to indicate in their OpenID4VCI Issuer metadata which of the methods A, B, C, or D the Wallet Unit must use for the PID, attestation, or WUA issued. Indicated methods SHALL be ordered by preference. This profile or extension SHALL also enable the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to set the value of parameters to be used by the Wallet Unit for each method (if applicable).
ISSU_39.notes: For example, the parameters to be set for method A include the lower limit for unused attestations and the batch size to be requested.
ISSU_39.searchText: issu_39 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the commission shall create or reference a profile or extension of the openid4vci specification enabling a pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to indicate in their openid4vci issuer metadata which of the methods a, b, c, or d the wallet unit must use for the pid, attestation, or wua issued. indicated methods shall be ordered by preference. this profile or extension shall also enable the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to set the value of parameters to be used by the wallet unit for each method (if applicable). for example, the parameters to be set for method a include the lower limit for unused attestations and the batch size to be requested.

ISSU_40.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_40.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_40.specification: PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers SHALL indicate in their OpenID4VCI Issuer metadata at least that either method A or method B must be used for a given type of PID, attestation, or WUA. PID Providers, Attestation Providers, and Wallet Providers MAY additionally indicate that it prefers using method C and/or method D over method A or method B. In such a case, a Wallet Unit supporting method C and/or method D SHALL use that method, while a Wallet Unit not supporting these methods SHALL use method A or method B, as applicable. *Example: An Attestation Provider indicates methods {D, C, A} in their metadata, in that order. A Wallet Unit that supports methods C and D (as well as A and B) then uses method D for this type of attestation. A Wallet Unit supporting methods A, B and C uses method C. A Wallet Unit supporting only methods A and B uses method A.*
ISSU_40.searchText: issu_40 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers shall indicate in their openid4vci issuer metadata at least that either method a or method b must be used for a given type of pid, attestation, or wua. pid providers, attestation providers, and wallet providers may additionally indicate that it prefers using method c and/or method d over method a or method b. in such a case, a wallet unit supporting method c and/or method d shall use that method, while a wallet unit not supporting these methods shall use method a or method b, as applicable. *example: an attestation provider indicates methods {d, c, a} in their metadata, in that order. a wallet unit that supports methods c and d (as well as a and b) then uses method d for this type of attestation. a wallet unit supporting methods a, b and c uses method c. a wallet unit supporting only methods a and b uses method a.*

ISSU_41.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_41.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_41.specification: To the maximum extent possible, Wallet Providers, PID Providers, and Attestation Providers SHALL ensure that Users do not notice which of the methods A, B, C, or D is used for their PIDs, attestations, or WUAs.
ISSU_41.searchText: issu_41 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit to the maximum extent possible, wallet providers, pid providers, and attestation providers shall ensure that users do not notice which of the methods a, b, c, or d is used for their pids, attestations, or wuas.

ISSU_42.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_42.subsection: D - HLRs for Privacy Risks and Mitigation
ISSU_42.specification: To the maximum extent possible, Wallet Providers, PID Providers, and Attestation Providers SHALL ensure that no User action is needed for the re-issuance of WUAs, PIDs, or attestations.
ISSU_42.notes: For the topic of re-issuance, see also the [Discussion Paper for Topic B](../../discussion-topics/b-re-issuance-and-batch-issuance-of-pids-and-attestations.md).
ISSU_42.searchText: issu_42 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit to the maximum extent possible, wallet providers, pid providers, and attestation providers shall ensure that no user action is needed for the re-issuance of wuas, pids, or attestations. for the topic of re-issuance, see also the [discussion paper for topic b](../../discussion-topics/b-re-issuance-and-batch-issuance-of-pids-and-attestations.md).

ISSU_43.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_43.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL request the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to issue PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in batches to the Wallet Unit. All PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in a batch SHALL have the same attribute values and the same technical validity period.
ISSU_43.searchText: issu_43 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall request the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to issue pids, attestations, or wuas in batches to the wallet unit. all pids, attestations, or wuas in a batch shall have the same attribute values and the same technical validity period.

ISSU_44.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_44.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL present each PID, attestation, or WUA only once to a Relying Party, except when it has fallen back to Method B as specified below, or to another available method.
ISSU_44.searchText: issu_44 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall present each pid, attestation, or wua only once to a relying party, except when it has fallen back to method b as specified below, or to another available method.

ISSU_45.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_45.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL have a lower limit for the number of unused PIDs, attestations, or WUAs it holds, and SHALL request the issuance of a new batch when this limit is reached. During the first issuance of a new PID, attestation, or WUA, see requirement ISSU_39, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider SHALL inform the Wallet Unit about the value of the lower limit and the size of the batch to be requested.
ISSU_45.searchText: issu_45 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall have a lower limit for the number of unused pids, attestations, or wuas it holds, and shall request the issuance of a new batch when this limit is reached. during the first issuance of a new pid, attestation, or wua, see requirement issu_39, the pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider shall inform the wallet unit about the value of the lower limit and the size of the batch to be requested.

ISSU_46.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_46.specification: If the Wallet Unit must request a new batch of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs, but is not able to do so because it is offline, the Wallet Unit SHALL warn the User that they are about to lose the possibility to present this PID or attestation to a Relying Party (or request (re-)issuance of a PID or attestation, in case of the WUA) and request them to connect their device to the internet.
ISSU_46.searchText: issu_46 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if the wallet unit must request a new batch of pids, attestations, or wuas, but is not able to do so because it is offline, the wallet unit shall warn the user that they are about to lose the possibility to present this pid or attestation to a relying party (or request (re-)issuance of a pid or attestation, in case of the wua) and request them to connect their device to the internet.

ISSU_47.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_47.specification: If the Wallet Unit has run out of unused PIDs, attestations, or WUAs, but is not able to request a new batch because it is offline, it SHALL fall back to method B (see requirement 6), or another available method. This means that, when requested by a Relying Party or Attestation Provider, the Wallet Unit SHALL again present one of the already used PIDs, attestations or WUAs. The Wallet Unit SHALL return to using method A as soon as it is able to go online and request a new batch of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs.
ISSU_47.searchText: issu_47 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if the wallet unit has run out of unused pids, attestations, or wuas, but is not able to request a new batch because it is offline, it shall fall back to method b (see requirement 6), or another available method. this means that, when requested by a relying party or attestation provider, the wallet unit shall again present one of the already used pids, attestations or wuas. the wallet unit shall return to using method a as soon as it is able to go online and request a new batch of pids, attestations, or wuas.

ISSU_48.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_48.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL request the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to issue a single PID, attestation, or WUA to the Wallet Unit.
ISSU_48.searchText: issu_48 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall request the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to issue a single pid, attestation, or wua to the wallet unit.

ISSU_49.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_49.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL present that PID, attestation, or WUA multiple times to the same Relying Party or Attestation Provider, or to different Relying Parties or Attestation Providers, when requested to do so.
ISSU_49.searchText: issu_49 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall present that pid, attestation, or wua multiple times to the same relying party or attestation provider, or to different relying parties or attestation providers, when requested to do so.

ISSU_50.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_50.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL request the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to re-issue a PID, attestation, or WUA some time before the one existing in the Wallet Unit expires. The PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL inform the Wallet Unit about the moment at which the Wallet Unit must request the re-issuance of a PID, attestation, or WUA, relative to the expiration date of the existing one.
ISSU_50.notes: It is the responsibility of the Relying Party receiving a PID or attestation (or the Attestation Provider receiving a WUA) to validate whether a presented PID, attestation, or WUA is temporally valid. A Wallet Unit is allowed to present a PID, attestation, or WUA even if its expiration date is in the past.
ISSU_50.searchText: issu_50 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall request the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to re-issue a pid, attestation, or wua some time before the one existing in the wallet unit expires. the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall inform the wallet unit about the moment at which the wallet unit must request the re-issuance of a pid, attestation, or wua, relative to the expiration date of the existing one. it is the responsibility of the relying party receiving a pid or attestation (or the attestation provider receiving a wua) to validate whether a presented pid, attestation, or wua is temporally valid. a wallet unit is allowed to present a pid, attestation, or wua even if its expiration date is in the past.

ISSU_51.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_51.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL request the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to issue PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in batches to the Wallet Unit. All PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in a batch SHALL have the same attribute values and the same technical validity period.
ISSU_51.searchText: issu_51 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall request the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to issue pids, attestations, or wuas in batches to the wallet unit. all pids, attestations, or wuas in a batch shall have the same attribute values and the same technical validity period.

ISSU_52.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_52.specification: When a presentation of attributes is requested by multiple Relying Parties, the Wallet Unit SHALL present each PID or attestation in a batch once, in a random order. Similarly, when a WUA is requested by multiple Attestation Providers, the Wallet Unit SHALL present each WUA in a batch once, in a random order.
ISSU_52.searchText: issu_52 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit when a presentation of attributes is requested by multiple relying parties, the wallet unit shall present each pid or attestation in a batch once, in a random order. similarly, when a wua is requested by multiple attestation providers, the wallet unit shall present each wua in a batch once, in a random order.

ISSU_53.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_53.specification: When all PIDs, attestations, or WUAs in a batch have been presented once, the Wallet Unit SHALL reset the batch, and start presenting each PID, attestation, or WUA in the batch again in a random order.
ISSU_53.searchText: issu_53 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit when all pids, attestations, or wuas in a batch have been presented once, the wallet unit shall reset the batch, and start presenting each pid, attestation, or wua in the batch again in a random order.

ISSU_54.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_54.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL request the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider to re-issue a batch of PIDs, attestations, or WUAs, some time before the batch in the Wallet Unit expires. The PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider SHALL inform the Wallet Unit about the size of the batch and about the moment at which the Wallet Unit must request the re-issuance of a batch, relative to the expiration date of the existing one.
ISSU_54.searchText: issu_54 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall request the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider to re-issue a batch of pids, attestations, or wuas, some time before the batch in the wallet unit expires. the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider shall inform the wallet unit about the size of the batch and about the moment at which the wallet unit must request the re-issuance of a batch, relative to the expiration date of the existing one.

ISSU_55.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_55.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL present a different PID, attestation, or WUA to each different Relying Party or Attestation Provider upon their request. This means that it SHALL comply with Method A for such Relying Parties or Attestation Providers.
ISSU_55.searchText: issu_55 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall present a different pid, attestation, or wua to each different relying party or attestation provider upon their request. this means that it shall comply with method a for such relying parties or attestation providers.

ISSU_56.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_56.specification: In case a given Relying Party requests attributes from a given type of PID or attestation multiple times, the Wallet Unit MAY present the same PID or attestation to this Relying Party each time. If it does, it SHALL comply with Method B or Method C for such a Relying Party.
ISSU_56.searchText: issu_56 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit in case a given relying party requests attributes from a given type of pid or attestation multiple times, the wallet unit may present the same pid or attestation to this relying party each time. if it does, it shall comply with method b or method c for such a relying party.

ISSU_56a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_56a.specification: In case a given Attestation Provider requests a WUA multiple times, the Wallet Unit MAY present the same WUA to this Attestation Provider each time. If it does, it SHALL comply with Method B or Method C for such an Attestation Provider.
ISSU_56a.searchText: issu_56a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit in case a given attestation provider requests a wua multiple times, the wallet unit may present the same wua to this attestation provider each time. if it does, it shall comply with method b or method c for such an attestation provider.

ISSU_57.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_57.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL keep track of which PID or attestation it has presented to which Relying Party.
ISSU_57.notes: To do so, the Wallet Unit can use the unique RP identifier from the extension of the presentation request meant in RPRC_19a.
ISSU_57.searchText: issu_57 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall keep track of which pid or attestation it has presented to which relying party. to do so, the wallet unit can use the unique rp identifier from the extension of the presentation request meant in rprc_19a.

ISSU_57a.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_57a.specification: The Wallet Unit SHALL keep track of which WUA it has presented to which Attestation Provider, using the unique identifier obtained from the respective access certificate.
ISSU_57a.searchText: issu_57a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the wallet unit shall keep track of which wua it has presented to which attestation provider, using the unique identifier obtained from the respective access certificate.

ISSU_58.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_58.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_58.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL give its User the option to manually initiate a re-issuance process for any of the PIDs or attestations in their Wallet Unit.
ISSU_58.notes: This requirement does not apply for WUAs, since Users must not be involved in the management of WUAs.
ISSU_58.searchText: issu_58 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall give its user the option to manually initiate a re-issuance process for any of the pids or attestations in their wallet unit. this requirement does not apply for wuas, since users must not be involved in the management of wuas.

ISSU_59.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_59.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_59.specification: After a successful re-issuance, a Wallet Unit SHALL compare the attribute values of the re-issued PID or attestation with those of the existing PID or attestation, and SHALL notify the User in case of any differences.
ISSU_59.notes: This requirement does not apply for WUAs, since Users must not be involved in the management of WUAs.
ISSU_59.searchText: issu_59 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a successful re-issuance, a wallet unit shall compare the attribute values of the re-issued pid or attestation with those of the existing pid or attestation, and shall notify the user in case of any differences. this requirement does not apply for wuas, since users must not be involved in the management of wuas.

ISSU_60.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_60.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_60.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL gracefully handle situations in which re-issuance of a PID, attestation, or WUA is refused by the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider,for example by attempting a retry after an appropriate delay.
ISSU_60.searchText: issu_60 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall gracefully handle situations in which re-issuance of a pid, attestation, or wua is refused by the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider,for example by attempting a retry after an appropriate delay.

ISSU_61.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_61.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_61.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support PID or attestation first-time batch issuance with a single User authentication, regardless of the size of the batch.
ISSU_61.notes: a) See also requirement WIAM_14. b) This requirement does not apply for WUAs, since Users must not be involved in the management of WUAs.
ISSU_61.searchText: issu_61 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support pid or attestation first-time batch issuance with a single user authentication, regardless of the size of the batch. a) see also requirement wiam_14. b) this requirement does not apply for wuas, since users must not be involved in the management of wuas.

ISSU_62.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_62.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_62.specification: If a PID, attestation, or WUA was successfully re-issued because the value of one or more of its attributes was changed (including attributes being added or deleted), a Wallet Unit SHOULD delete the correct pre-existing PID, attestation, or WUA.
ISSU_62.notes: a) It is up to the Wallet Unit, possibly using metadata provided by the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider using the [OpenID4VCI] protocol, to determine the PID, attestation, or WUA to be deleted. b) Additionally, per requirement VCR_09, the PID Provider, Attestation Provider, or Wallet Provider revokes the pre-existing PID, attestation, or WUA.
ISSU_62.searchText: issu_62 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if a pid, attestation, or wua was successfully re-issued because the value of one or more of its attributes was changed (including attributes being added or deleted), a wallet unit should delete the correct pre-existing pid, attestation, or wua. a) it is up to the wallet unit, possibly using metadata provided by the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider using the [openid4vci] protocol, to determine the pid, attestation, or wua to be deleted. b) additionally, per requirement vcr_09, the pid provider, attestation provider, or wallet provider revokes the pre-existing pid, attestation, or wua.

ISSU_63.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_63.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_63.specification: PID Providers, Attestation Providers, Wallet Providers, and Wallet Units SHALL support the features of [OpenID4VCI] enabling the re-issuance of PIDs, attestations, and WUAs.
ISSU_63.searchText: issu_63 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit pid providers, attestation providers, wallet providers, and wallet units shall support the features of [openid4vci] enabling the re-issuance of pids, attestations, and wuas.

ISSU_64.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_64.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_64.specification: PID Providers, Attestation Providers, Wallet Providers, and Wallet Units SHALL support the features of [OpenID4VCI] enabling the batch issuance of PIDs, attestations, and WUAs.
ISSU_64.searchText: issu_64 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit pid providers, attestation providers, wallet providers, and wallet units shall support the features of [openid4vci] enabling the batch issuance of pids, attestations, and wuas.

ISSU_65.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_65.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_65.specification: The common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable a PID Provider, Attestation Provider or Wallet Provider to verify that a re-issued PID, device-bound attestation, or WUA is bound to the same WSCA/WSCD or keystore to which the existing PID, device-bound attestation, or WUA is bound.
ISSU_65.notes: This can be done, for instance, by requiring that OAuth 2.0 Demonstrating Proof of Possession (DPoP) [RFC 9449] is used for each Refresh Token, and that the private key of the Refresh Token and the private key of the existing PID, attestation, or WUA are stored in the same WSCA/WSCD or keystore.
ISSU_65.searchText: issu_65 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the common openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable a pid provider, attestation provider or wallet provider to verify that a re-issued pid, device-bound attestation, or wua is bound to the same wsca/wscd or keystore to which the existing pid, device-bound attestation, or wua is bound. this can be done, for instance, by requiring that oauth 2.0 demonstrating proof of possession (dpop) [rfc 9449] is used for each refresh token, and that the private key of the refresh token and the private key of the existing pid, attestation, or wua are stored in the same wsca/wscd or keystore.

ISSU_66.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
ISSU_66.subsection: E - HLRs for re-issuance and batch issuance of PIDs, attestations and WUAs
ISSU_66.specification: The common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable an Attestation Provider to verify that the Refresh Token used for the re-issuance of a non device-bound attestation is bound to a WSCA/WSCD or keystore included with the Wallet Unit in which the replaced attestation is stored.
ISSU_66.notes: a) This requirement implies that if an Attestation Provider enables re-issuance of an attestation by issuing Refresh Tokens, these tokens must be device-bound, even in case the attestation itself is not device-bound. b) This requirement does not apply to PIDs and WUAs, since these are bound to the WSCA/WSCD because they must be issued and managed at Level of Assurance High.
ISSU_66.searchText: issu_66 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the common openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable an attestation provider to verify that the refresh token used for the re-issuance of a non device-bound attestation is bound to a wsca/wscd or keystore included with the wallet unit in which the replaced attestation is stored. a) this requirement implies that if an attestation provider enables re-issuance of an attestation by issuing refresh tokens, these tokens must be device-bound, even in case the attestation itself is not device-bound. b) this requirement does not apply to pids and wuas, since these are bound to the wsca/wscd because they must be issued and managed at level of assurance high.

PA_01.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_01.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable a User to generate a Pseudonym and register it at a Relying Party.
PA_01.searchText: pa_01 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable a user to generate a pseudonym and register it at a relying party.

PA_02.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_02.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable a User to authenticate with a Pseudonym towards a Relying Party if the Wallet Unit was used previously to register the Pseudonym for the same Relying Party
PA_02.searchText: pa_02 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable a user to authenticate with a pseudonym towards a relying party if the wallet unit was used previously to register the pseudonym for the same relying party

PA_03.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_03.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL be able to perform the actions specified in the above two requirements independently of whether the interaction with the Relying Party is initiated on the same device hosting the Wallet Instance or on a device different from the one hosting the Wallet Instance.
PA_03.searchText: pa_03 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall be able to perform the actions specified in the above two requirements independently of whether the interaction with the relying party is initiated on the same device hosting the wallet instance or on a device different from the one hosting the wallet instance.

PA_04.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_04.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable the User to use multiple different Pseudonyms at a given Relying Party.
PA_04.searchText: pa_04 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable the user to use multiple different pseudonyms at a given relying party.

PA_05.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_05.specification: A Wallet Unit SHOULD enable a User to freely choose a User alias for each Pseudonym registered at a Relying Party. Setting an alias SHOULD be optional for the User. The User SHOULD be able to change the alias for any Pseudonym.
PA_05.searchText: pa_05 pseudonyms a wallet unit should enable a user to freely choose a user alias for each pseudonym registered at a relying party. setting an alias should be optional for the user. the user should be able to change the alias for any pseudonym.

PA_06.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_06.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable a User to choose which Pseudonym to authenticate with towards a Relying Party, if multiple Pseudonyms are registered for this Relying Party. The Wallet Unit SHOULD present the User with the aliases of the applicable Pseudonyms, if assigned, when making this choice.
PA_06.searchText: pa_06 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable a user to choose which pseudonym to authenticate with towards a relying party, if multiple pseudonyms are registered for this relying party. the wallet unit should present the user with the aliases of the applicable pseudonyms, if assigned, when making this choice.

PA_07.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_07.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable a User to delete a Pseudonym.
PA_07.searchText: pa_07 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable a user to delete a pseudonym.

PA_08.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_08.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable the User to manage Pseudonyms within the Wallet Unit in a user-friendly and transparent manner.
PA_08.searchText: pa_08 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable the user to manage pseudonyms within the wallet unit in a user-friendly and transparent manner.

PA_08a.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_08a.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL log Pseudonym registration and presentation transactions as specified in [Topic 19](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2312-topic-19---user-navigation-requirements-dashboard-logs-for-transparency).
PA_08a.searchText: pa_08a pseudonyms a wallet unit shall log pseudonym registration and presentation transactions as specified in [topic 19](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2312-topic-19---user-navigation-requirements-dashboard-logs-for-transparency).

PA_09.subsection: A. HLRs related to Use Cases
PA_09.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable the User to see all existing pseudonyms, including the associated Relying Party.
PA_09.searchText: pa_09 pseudonyms a wallet unit shall enable the user to see all existing pseudonyms, including the associated relying party.

PA_10.subsection: B. HLRs related to Relying Parties
PA_10.specification: A Relying Party SHALL be able to verify that a User is registering a Pseudonym using a non-revoked Wallet Unit.
PA_10.searchText: pa_10 pseudonyms a relying party shall be able to verify that a user is registering a pseudonym using a non-revoked wallet unit.

PA_11.subsection: B. HLRs related to Relying Parties
