Reg_13.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority logs all issued access certificates for Certificate Transparency (CT), according to all requirements in [Topic 55](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2333-topic-55---certificate-transparency).
Reg_13.searchText: reg_13 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate authority logs all issued access certificates for certificate transparency (ct), according to all requirements in [topic 55](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2333-topic-55---certificate-transparency).

Reg_14.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_14.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_14.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority provides one or more method(s) to revoke the access certificates it issued.
Reg_14.searchText: reg_14 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate authority provides one or more method(s) to revoke the access certificates it issued.

Reg_15.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_15.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_15.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL include a policy for revocation, which SHALL require that an Access Certificate Authority revokes an access certificate at least when: - the certificate subject which is a Relying Party is suspended or cancelled by the respective Registrar, - the certificate subject which is a PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, or non-qualified EAA Provider is suspended or cancelled by the respective Registrar, - on request of the certificate subject, or - on request of a competent national authority.
Reg_15.searchText: reg_15 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall include a policy for revocation, which shall require that an access certificate authority revokes an access certificate at least when: - the certificate subject which is a relying party is suspended or cancelled by the respective registrar, - the certificate subject which is a pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, or non-qualified eaa provider is suspended or cancelled by the respective registrar, - on request of the certificate subject, or - on request of a competent national authority.

Reg_16.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_16.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_16.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL specify the profile of access certificates in detail.
Reg_16.searchText: reg_16 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall specify the profile of access certificates in detail.

Reg_17.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_17.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_17.searchText: reg_17 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_18.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_18.subsection: B. General requirements for the issuance of access certificates
Reg_18.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.
Reg_18.searchText: reg_18 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall define the minimum change history information to be stored for resolving possible disputes regarding registration.

Reg_19.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_19.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_19.specification: A Member State SHALL approve a PID Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its PID Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of PID Providers in its Registry.
Reg_19.searchText: reg_19 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve a pid provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its pid provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of pid providers in its registry.

Reg_20.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20.specification: A Member State SHALL identify PID Providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent PID Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_20.searchText: reg_20 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify pid providers at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent pid provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_20a.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20a.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20a.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered PID Provider.
Reg_20a.searchText: reg_20a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered pid provider.

Reg_20b.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_20b.subsection: C. Requirements for the registration of PID Providers
Reg_20b.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered PID Provider, which SHALL specify that a PID Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the PID Provider or of a competent national authority.
Reg_20b.searchText: reg_20b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered pid provider, which shall specify that a pid provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the pid provider or of a competent national authority.

Reg_21.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_21.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_21.specification: A Member State SHALL approve an Attestation Provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its Attestation Provider Registry. To that end, a Member State SHALL define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of Attestation Providers in its Registry. These processes and rules SHOULD consider any relevant differences between QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers.
Reg_21.searchText: reg_21 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall approve an attestation provider according to a well-defined policy before including it in its attestation provider registry. to that end, a member state shall define specific vetting processes and rules of acceptance for inclusion of attestation providers in its registry. these processes and rules should consider any relevant differences between qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers.

Reg_22.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22.specification: A Member State SHALL identify Attestation Providers (i.e., QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers and non-qualified EAA Providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Attestation Provider could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_22.searchText: reg_22 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify attestation providers (i.e., qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers and non-qualified eaa providers) at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent attestation provider could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_22a.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22a.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22a.specification: A Registrar SHALL provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered Attestation Provider.
Reg_22a.searchText: reg_22a registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall provide a method to suspend or cancel a registered attestation provider.

Reg_22b.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_22b.subsection: D. Requirements for the registration of Attestation Providers
Reg_22b.specification: A Registrar SHALL have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered Attestation Provider, which SHALL specify that an Attestation Provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the Attestation Provider or of a competent national authority.
Reg_22b.searchText: reg_22b registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a registrar shall have a policy for the suspension or cancellation of a registered attestation provider, which shall specify that an attestation provider is suspended or cancelled at least on request of the attestation provider or of a competent national authority.

Reg_23.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_23.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_23.searchText: reg_23 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_24.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_24.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_24.specification: A Member State SHALL enable a Relying Party to register remotely, using an API or user interface.
Reg_24.searchText: reg_24 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall enable a relying party to register remotely, using an api or user interface.

Reg_25.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_25.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_25.specification: A Member State SHALL identify a Relying Party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent Relying Party could cause to Users and other stakeholders in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem.
Reg_25.searchText: reg_25 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall identify a relying party at a level of confidence proportionate to the risk arising from the potential harm a fraudulent relying party could cause to users and other stakeholders in the eudi wallet ecosystem.

Reg_26.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_26.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_26.specification: With respect to Reg_25, a Member State SHALL consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary.
Reg_26.notes: According to the [European Digital Identity Regulation], an intermediary is a Relying Party.
Reg_26.searchText: reg_26 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties with respect to reg_25, a member state shall consider whether a registering entity intends to act as an intermediary. according to the [european digital identity regulation], an intermediary is a relying party.

Reg_27.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_27.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_27.searchText: reg_27 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_28.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_28.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_28.searchText: reg_28 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_29.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_29.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_29.specification: A Member State SHALL have a policy for the cancellation of a registered Relying Party, which SHALL specify that a Relying Party is cancelled at least on request of the Relying Party or of a competent national authority.
Reg_29.searchText: reg_29 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties a member state shall have a policy for the cancellation of a registered relying party, which shall specify that a relying party is cancelled at least on request of the relying party or of a competent national authority.

Reg_30.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_30.subsection: E. Requirements for the registration of Relying Parties
Reg_30.searchText: reg_30 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

Reg_31.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_31.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_31.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains a name for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, in a format suitable for presenting to a User.
Reg_31.searchText: reg_31 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains a name for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, in a format suitable for presenting to a user.

Reg_32.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_32.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_32.specification: The common Certificate Policy mentioned in Reg_12 SHALL require that an access certificate contains an EU-wide unique identifier for the PID Provider, QEAA Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, non-qualified EAA Provider, or Relying Party, and SHALL specify a method for deriving such identifiers.
Reg_32.notes: a) The EU-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the Registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the Relying Party allocated by this Registrar. b) This Relying Party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.
Reg_32.searchText: reg_32 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties the common certificate policy mentioned in reg_12 shall require that an access certificate contains an eu-wide unique identifier for the pid provider, qeaa provider, pub-eaa provider, non-qualified eaa provider, or relying party, and shall specify a method for deriving such identifiers. a) the eu-wide unique identifier could, for example, be a composition of a unique identifier of the registrar, defined in the policy, and a unique identifier for the relying party allocated by this registrar. b) this relying party identifier is identical in all access certificates issued to a given entity.

Reg_33.topicTitle: Registration of PID Providers, Providers of QEAAs, PuB-EAAs, and non-qualified EAAs, and Relying Parties
Reg_33.subsection: F. Requirements for the contents of access certificates
Reg_33.searchText: reg_33 registration of pid providers, providers of qeaas, pub-eaas, and non-qualified eaas, and relying parties empty

GenNot_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
GenNot_01.specification: Member States SHALL notify all PID Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, Wallet Providers, Access Certificate Authorities, and Providers of registration certificates to the European Commission, according all relevant requirements in [Technical Specification 2](../../technical-specifications/ts2-notification-publication-provider-information.md).
GenNot_01.searchText: gennot_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates member states shall notify all pid providers, pub-eaa providers, wallet providers, access certificate authorities, and providers of registration certificates to the european commission, according all relevant requirements in [technical specification 2](../../technical-specifications/ts2-notification-publication-provider-information.md).

GenNot_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
GenNot_02.specification: As part of [Technical Specification 2] referred to in GenNot_01, the European Commission SHALL establish standard operating procedures for the notification of a PID Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, Wallet Provider, Access Certificate Authority, or Provider of registration certificates to the Commission.
GenNot_02.notes: The outcome of the notification procedure is the publication of the information notified by the Member State according to [Article 5a](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e1347-1-1) (18) in a machine and human readable manner using the common system mentioned in Section H, TLPub_01.
GenNot_02.searchText: gennot_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates as part of [technical specification 2] referred to in gennot_01, the european commission shall establish standard operating procedures for the notification of a pid provider, pub-eaa provider, wallet provider, access certificate authority, or provider of registration certificates to the commission. the outcome of the notification procedure is the publication of the information notified by the member state according to [article 5a](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e1347-1-1) (18) in a machine and human readable manner using the common system mentioned in section h, tlpub_01.

GenNot_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
GenNot_03.specification: The common system mentioned in GenNot_01 SHALL enable: - A secure notification channel between Member States and the Commission for all notifications. - A notification, verification, and publication process and associated validation steps (with follow-up and monitoring) at the Commission side. - Collected data to be processed, consolidated, signed or sealed, and published in both a machine-processable Trusted List and in a human-readable format, manually and/or automatically using e.g. a web service and/or API.
GenNot_03.searchText: gennot_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the common system mentioned in gennot_01 shall enable: - a secure notification channel between member states and the commission for all notifications. - a notification, verification, and publication process and associated validation steps (with follow-up and monitoring) at the commission side. - collected data to be processed, consolidated, signed or sealed, and published in both a machine-processable trusted list and in a human-readable format, manually and/or automatically using e.g. a web service and/or api.

GenNot_04.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
GenNot_04.specification: As regard to GenNot_03, second bullet, the Commission SHALL verify whether the notified data is complete and meets the technical specifications, while the Member States SHALL be responsible for the correctness of the notified information.
GenNot_04.searchText: gennot_04 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates as regard to gennot_03, second bullet, the commission shall verify whether the notified data is complete and meets the technical specifications, while the member states shall be responsible for the correctness of the notified information.

GenNot_05.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
GenNot_05.specification: As part of the specifications referred to in GenNot_01, the European Commission SHALL establish standard operating procedures for the suspension or cancellation of a PID Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, Wallet Provider, Access Certificate Authority, or Provider of registration certificates. These operating procedures SHALL include unambiguous conditions for suspension or cancellation. As an outcome of the suspension or cancellation procedure, the status of the suspended or cancelled PID Provider, PuB-EAA Provider, Wallet Provider, Access Certificate Authority or Provider of registration certificates in the Trusted List SHALL be changed to Invalid.
GenNot_05.searchText: gennot_05 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates as part of the specifications referred to in gennot_01, the european commission shall establish standard operating procedures for the suspension or cancellation of a pid provider, pub-eaa provider, wallet provider, access certificate authority, or provider of registration certificates. these operating procedures shall include unambiguous conditions for suspension or cancellation. as an outcome of the suspension or cancellation procedure, the status of the suspended or cancelled pid provider, pub-eaa provider, wallet provider, access certificate authority or provider of registration certificates in the trusted list shall be changed to invalid.

PPNot_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_01.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_01.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about PID Providers.
PPNot_01.searchText: ppnot_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about pid providers.

PPNot_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_02.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_02.specification: The common set of information to be notified about a PID Provider SHALL include at least: 1. Identification data: i. MS/Country of establishment, ii. Name as registered in an official record, iii. Where applicable: a. A business registration number from an official record, b. Identification data from that official record. 2. PID Provider trust anchors, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1) ii) above, supporting the authentication of PIDs issued by the PID Provider, 3. Trust anchors of Access Certificate Authorities for PID Providers, i.e., public keys and CA name, supporting the authentication of the PID Provider by Wallet Units at the service supply point(s) listed per point 4. below. 4. Service supply point(s), i.e., the URL(s) at which a Wallet Unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a PID.
PPNot_02.notes: a) Relating to point 3. above: PID Provider Access Certificate Authority trust anchors are notified separately from the Access Certificate Authority for Relying Parties (see Section G below), since PID Providers are -legally speaking- not Relying Parties. b) For the concept of an Access Certificate Authority, see also [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties) and [Section 6.3.2 of the ARF main document](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#632-pid-provider-or-attestation-provider-registration-and-notification).
PPNot_02.searchText: ppnot_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the common set of information to be notified about a pid provider shall include at least: 1. identification data: i. ms/country of establishment, ii. name as registered in an official record, iii. where applicable: a. a business registration number from an official record, b. identification data from that official record. 2. pid provider trust anchors, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1) ii) above, supporting the authentication of pids issued by the pid provider, 3. trust anchors of access certificate authorities for pid providers, i.e., public keys and ca name, supporting the authentication of the pid provider by wallet units at the service supply point(s) listed per point 4. below. 4. service supply point(s), i.e., the url(s) at which a wallet unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a pid. a) relating to point 3. above: pid provider access certificate authority trust anchors are notified separately from the access certificate authority for relying parties (see section g below), since pid providers are -legally speaking- not relying parties. b) for the concept of an access certificate authority, see also [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)] and [section 6.3.2 of the arf main document](../../architecture-and-reference-framework-main.md#632-pid-provider-or-attestation-provider-registration-and-notification).

PPNot_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_03.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_03.specification: PID Providers SHALL ensure that all PIDs they issue can be authenticated using the PID Provider trust anchors notified to the Commission.
PPNot_03.searchText: ppnot_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates pid providers shall ensure that all pids they issue can be authenticated using the pid provider trust anchors notified to the commission.

PPNot_04.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_04.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_04.specification: PID Providers SHALL ensure that their PID Provider access certificates can be authenticated using the applicable Access Certificate Authority trust anchors notified to the Commission.
PPNot_04.notes: [Topic 6](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a234-topic-6---relying-party-authentication-and-user-approval) describes how access certificates will be used.
PPNot_04.searchText: ppnot_04 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates pid providers shall ensure that their pid provider access certificates can be authenticated using the applicable access certificate authority trust anchors notified to the commission. [[topic 6](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a234-topic-6---relying-party-authentication-and-user-approval)] describes how access certificates will be used.

PPNot_05.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_05.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_05.specification: PID Provider trust anchors SHALL be accepted because of their secure notification by the Member States to the Commission and by their publication in the corresponding Commission-compiled PID Provider Trusted List which is sealed by the Commission.
PPNot_05.searchText: ppnot_05 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates pid provider trust anchors shall be accepted because of their secure notification by the member states to the commission and by their publication in the corresponding commission-compiled pid provider trusted list which is sealed by the commission.

PPNot_06.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_06.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_06.specification: Access Certificate Authority trust anchors SHALL be accepted because of their secure notification by the Member States to the Commission and by their publication in the corresponding Commission-compiled Access Certificate Authority Trusted List which is signed or sealed by the Commission.
PPNot_06.searchText: ppnot_06 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates access certificate authority trust anchors shall be accepted because of their secure notification by the member states to the commission and by their publication in the corresponding commission-compiled access certificate authority trusted list which is signed or sealed by the commission.

PPNot_07.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PPNot_07.subsection: B. Requirements for the notification of PID Providers
PPNot_07.specification: The format of the PID Provider Trusted List SHALL comply with ETSI TS 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from ETSI TS 102 231.
PPNot_07.searchText: ppnot_07 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the format of the pid provider trusted list shall comply with etsi ts 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from etsi ts 102 231.

WPNot_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_01.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_01.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about Wallet Providers.
WPNot_01.searchText: wpnot_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about wallet providers.

WPNot_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_02.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_02.specification: The common set of information to be notified about a Wallet Provider SHALL include: 1. Identification data: i. MS/Country of establishment, ii. Name as registered in an official record, iii. Where applicable: a. Business registration number from an official record, and b. Identification data from the official record. 2. Wallet Provider trust anchors, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1. b. above, supporting the authentication of Wallet Unit Attestations issued by the Wallet Provider.
WPNot_02.notes: a) See [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation) and [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation) for the definition of the WUA. b) A Wallet Provider does not need an access certificate to interact with Wallet Units.
WPNot_02.searchText: wpnot_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the common set of information to be notified about a wallet provider shall include: 1. identification data: i. ms/country of establishment, ii. name as registered in an official record, iii. where applicable: a. business registration number from an official record, and b. identification data from the official record. 2. wallet provider trust anchors, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1. b. above, supporting the authentication of wallet unit attestations issued by the wallet provider. a) see [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)] and [[topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation)] for the definition of the wua. b) a wallet provider does not need an access certificate to interact with wallet units.

WPNot_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_03.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_03.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that all WUAs they issue can be authenticated using the trust anchors notified to the Commission.
WPNot_03.searchText: wpnot_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates wallet providers shall ensure that all wuas they issue can be authenticated using the trust anchors notified to the commission.

WPNot_04.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_04.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_04.specification: Wallet Provider trust anchors SHALL be accepted because of their secure notification by the Member States to the Commission and by their publication in the corresponding Commission-compiled Wallet Provider Trusted List which is sealed by the Commission.
WPNot_04.searchText: wpnot_04 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates wallet provider trust anchors shall be accepted because of their secure notification by the member states to the commission and by their publication in the corresponding commission-compiled wallet provider trusted list which is sealed by the commission.

WPNot_05.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_05.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_05.specification: The format of the Wallet Provider Trusted List SHALL comply with ETSI TS 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from ETSI TS 102 231.
WPNot_05.searchText: wpnot_05 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the format of the wallet provider trusted list shall comply with etsi ts 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from etsi ts 102 231.

WPNot_06.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
WPNot_06.subsection: C. Requirements for the notification of Wallet Providers
WPNot_06.specification: If a Wallet Provider is cancelled (see requirement GenNot_05 above), that Wallet Provider SHALL immediately revoke all of its valid WUAs, in accordance with the requirements in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). If a Wallet Provider is suspended, that Wallet Provider and the Member State SHALL agree on the necessary precautionary measures that need to be taken, which MAY include the immediate revocation of all or some of its valid WUAs.
WPNot_06.searchText: wpnot_06 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates if a wallet provider is cancelled (see requirement gennot_05 above), that wallet provider shall immediately revoke all of its valid wuas, in accordance with the requirements in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). if a wallet provider is suspended, that wallet provider and the member state shall agree on the necessary precautionary measures that need to be taken, which may include the immediate revocation of all or some of its valid wuas.

PuBPNot_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PuBPNot_01.subsection: D. Requirements for the notification of PuB-EAA Providers
PuBPNot_01.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about PuB-EAA Providers.
PuBPNot_01.searchText: pubpnot_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about pub-eaa providers.

PuBPNot_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PuBPNot_02.subsection: D. Requirements for the notification of PuB-EAA Providers
PuBPNot_02.specification: The common set of information to be notified by Member States about PuB-EAA Providers SHALL include at least: 1. Identification data: i. MS/Country of establishment, ii. Name as registered in an official record, iii. Where applicable: a. Registration number as in official record, and b. Official record identification data. iv. Identification data of the Union or national law under which a. Either the PuB-EAA Provider is established as the responsible body for the Authentic Source based on which the electronic attestation of attributes is issued, or b. The PuB-EAA Provider is the body designated to act on behalf of the responsible body referred to in point 1. iv. a. v.The conformity assessment report issued by a conformity assessment body, confirming that the requirements set out in paragraphs 1, 2 and 6 of [Article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e3902-1-1) are met. 2. Service supply point(s), i.e., the URL(s) at which a Wallet Unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a PuB-EAA from the PuB-EAA Provider.
PuBPNot_02.searchText: pubpnot_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the common set of information to be notified by member states about pub-eaa providers shall include at least: 1. identification data: i. ms/country of establishment, ii. name as registered in an official record, iii. where applicable: a. registration number as in official record, and b. official record identification data. iv. identification data of the union or national law under which a. either the pub-eaa provider is established as the responsible body for the authentic source based on which the electronic attestation of attributes is issued, or b. the pub-eaa provider is the body designated to act on behalf of the responsible body referred to in point 1. iv. a. v.the conformity assessment report issued by a conformity assessment body, confirming that the requirements set out in paragraphs 1, 2 and 6 of [article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e3902-1-1) are met. 2. service supply point(s), i.e., the url(s) at which a wallet unit can start the process of requesting and obtaining a pub-eaa from the pub-eaa provider.

PuBPNot_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
PuBPNot_03.subsection: D. Requirements for the notification of PuB-EAA Providers
PuBPNot_03.specification: The format of the PuB-EAA Provider Trusted List SHALL comply with ETSI TS 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from ETSI TS 102 231.
PuBPNot_03.searchText: pubpnot_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the format of the pub-eaa provider trusted list shall comply with etsi ts 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from etsi ts 102 231.

RPACANot_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_01.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_01.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates.
RPACANot_01.searchText: rpacanot_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the common set of information to be notified about access certificate authorities and providers of registration certificates.

RPACANot_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_02.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_02.specification: The common set of information to be notified about an Access Certificate Authority or a Provider of registration certificates SHALL include: 1. Identification data: i) Member State or country of establishment, ii) Name as registered in an official record, iii) Where applicable: - A business registration number from an official record, - Identification data from that official record. 2. Trust anchors of the Access Certificate Authority or Provider of registration certificates, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1) ii), supporting the authentication of Relying Parties, PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers by Wallet Units.
RPACANot_02.searchText: rpacanot_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the common set of information to be notified about an access certificate authority or a provider of registration certificates shall include: 1. identification data: i) member state or country of establishment, ii) name as registered in an official record, iii) where applicable: - a business registration number from an official record, - identification data from that official record. 2. trust anchors of the access certificate authority or provider of registration certificates, i.e., public keys and name as per point 1) ii), supporting the authentication of relying parties, pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers by wallet units.

RPACANot_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_03.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_03.specification: Relying Parties, PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers SHALL ensure that their access certificates can be authenticated using the trust anchors of an Access Certificate Authority notified to the Commission.
RPACANot_03.searchText: rpacanot_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates relying parties, pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers shall ensure that their access certificates can be authenticated using the trust anchors of an access certificate authority notified to the commission.

RPACANot_03a.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_03a.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_03a.specification: Relying Parties, PID Providers, QEAA Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, and non-qualified EAA Providers SHALL ensure that their registration certificates, if issued to them, can be authenticated using the trust anchors of a Provider of registration certificates notified to the Commission.
RPACANot_03a.searchText: rpacanot_03a notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates relying parties, pid providers, qeaa providers, pub-eaa providers, and non-qualified eaa providers shall ensure that their registration certificates, if issued to them, can be authenticated using the trust anchors of a provider of registration certificates notified to the commission.

RPACANot_04.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_04.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_04.specification: The trust anchors of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates SHALL be accepted because of their secure notification by the Member States to the Commission and by their publication in the corresponding Commission-compiled Trusted Lists, which are signed or sealed by the Commission.
RPACANot_04.searchText: rpacanot_04 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the trust anchors of access certificate authorities and providers of registration certificates shall be accepted because of their secure notification by the member states to the commission and by their publication in the corresponding commission-compiled trusted lists, which are signed or sealed by the commission.

RPACANot_05.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_05.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_05.specification: The format of the Trusted Lists mentioned in RPACANot_04 SHALL comply with ETSI TS 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from ETSI TS 102 231.
RPACANot_05.searchText: rpacanot_05 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the format of the trusted lists mentioned in rpacanot_04 shall comply with etsi ts 119 612 v2.1.1 or with a suitable profile similarly derived from etsi ts 102 231.

RPACANot_06.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_06.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_06.specification: If an Access Certificate Authority is suspended or cancelled (see requirement GenNot_05 above), that Access Certificate Authority SHALL immediately revoke all of its temporally valid access certificates.
RPACANot_06.notes: This implies that if an intermediary obtained its access certificates from an Access Certificate Authority that is suspended or cancelled, any intermediated Relying Parties depending on that intermediary will not be able to request attributes from Wallet Units, even though it has valid registration certificates. Such an intermediated Relying Party will either have to transit to another intermediary (which has access certificates issued by an active Access Certification Authority) or wait until the original intermediary obtains new access certificates either from another Access CA or from the original one, once that CA can continue its operations.
RPACANot_06.searchText: rpacanot_06 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates if an access certificate authority is suspended or cancelled (see requirement gennot_05 above), that access certificate authority shall immediately revoke all of its temporally valid access certificates. this implies that if an intermediary obtained its access certificates from an access certificate authority that is suspended or cancelled, any intermediated relying parties depending on that intermediary will not be able to request attributes from wallet units, even though it has valid registration certificates. such an intermediated relying party will either have to transit to another intermediary (which has access certificates issued by an active access certification authority) or wait until the original intermediary obtains new access certificates either from another access ca or from the original one, once that ca can continue its operations.

RPACANot_07.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
RPACANot_07.subsection: E. Requirements for the notification of Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates
RPACANot_07.specification: If a Provider of registration certificates is suspended or cancelled (see requirement GenNot_05 above), that Provider SHALL immediately revoke all of its valid registration certificates (if any). Moreover, the corresponding Registrar SHALL prohibit all access to the registry entries published online per Reg_03 and Reg_04.
RPACANot_07.searchText: rpacanot_07 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates if a provider of registration certificates is suspended or cancelled (see requirement gennot_05 above), that provider shall immediately revoke all of its valid registration certificates (if any). moreover, the corresponding registrar shall prohibit all access to the registry entries published online per reg_03 and reg_04.

TLPub_01.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_01.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_01.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the system enabling the publication by the Commission of the information notified by the Member States regarding PID Providers, Wallet Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, Access Certificate Authorities, and Providers of registration certificates.
TLPub_01.searchText: tlpub_01 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the system enabling the publication by the commission of the information notified by the member states regarding pid providers, wallet providers, pub-eaa providers, access certificate authorities, and providers of registration certificates.

TLPub_02.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_02.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_02.specification: The European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for the set of information to be published about PID Providers, Wallet Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, Access Certificate Authorities and Providers of registration certificates, based on the information notified by the Member States.
TLPub_02.notes: The information to be published MAY be different from the information to be notified per requirements PPNot_01, WPNot_01, PuBPNot_01, and RPACANot_01 above, respectively.
TLPub_02.searchText: tlpub_02 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the european commission shall establish technical specifications for the set of information to be published about pid providers, wallet providers, pub-eaa providers, access certificate authorities and providers of registration certificates, based on the information notified by the member states. the information to be published may be different from the information to be notified per requirements ppnot_01, wpnot_01, pubpnot_01, and rpacanot_01 above, respectively.

TLPub_03.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_03.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_03.specification: The publication of the information referred to in TLPub_01 SHALL take place over a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the published information.
TLPub_03.searchText: tlpub_03 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the publication of the information referred to in tlpub_01 shall take place over a secure channel protecting the authenticity and integrity of the published information.

TLPub_04.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_04.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_04.specification: The technical system mentioned in TLPub_01 SHALL NOT require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any entity wishing to retrieve the published information.
TLPub_04.searchText: tlpub_04 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the technical system mentioned in tlpub_01 shall not require authentication or prior registration and authorisation of any entity wishing to retrieve the published information.

TLPub_05.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_05.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_05.specification: The information referred to in TLPub_01 SHALL be published in an electronically signed or sealed form that is suitable for automated processing, and in a human-readable format, e.g., through introspection and display facilities, over an authenticated channel.
TLPub_05.searchText: tlpub_05 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the information referred to in tlpub_01 shall be published in an electronically signed or sealed form that is suitable for automated processing, and in a human-readable format, e.g., through introspection and display facilities, over an authenticated channel.

TLPub_06.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_06.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_06.specification: The Commission SHALL publish in the OJEU the locations of the Trusted Lists for PID Providers, Wallet Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, Access Certificate Authorities, and Providers of registration certificates.
TLPub_06.searchText: tlpub_06 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the commission shall publish in the ojeu the locations of the trusted lists for pid providers, wallet providers, pub-eaa providers, access certificate authorities, and providers of registration certificates.

TLPub_07.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_07.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_07.specification: The Commission SHALL publish in the OJEU the trust anchors to be used for verifying the signature or seal mentioned in TLPub_05.
TLPub_07.searchText: tlpub_07 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates the commission shall publish in the ojeu the trust anchors to be used for verifying the signature or seal mentioned in tlpub_05.

TLPub_08.topicTitle: Notification and publication of PID Provider, Wallet Provider, Attestation Provider, Access Certificate Authority, and Provider of registration certificates
TLPub_08.subsection: F. Requirements for the publication of Trusted Lists compiled by the
TLPub_08.specification: As part of the specifications referred to in TLPub_01, the European Commission SHALL establish technical specifications for ensuring the availability and authenticity of the full history regarding the information notified about PID Providers, Wallet Providers, PuB-EAA Providers, Access Certificate Authorities, and Providers of registration certificates.
TLPub_08.searchText: tlpub_08 notification and publication of pid provider, wallet provider, attestation provider, access certificate authority, and provider of registration certificates as part of the specifications referred to in tlpub_01, the european commission shall establish technical specifications for ensuring the availability and authenticity of the full history regarding the information notified about pid providers, wallet providers, pub-eaa providers, access certificate authorities, and providers of registration certificates.

QTSPAS_01.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_01.specification: In accordance with technical specifications referred to in QTSPAS_07, Member States SHALL define: - discovery mechanisms that enable QTSPs to request information about Authentic Sources or designated intermediaries recognised at the national level. This includes information regarding the attributes of a natural or legal person for which the Authentic Source or designated intermediary is considered a primary source, or for which it is recognised as authentic in accordance with Union law or national law, including administrative practices. - procedures for QTSPs to request the verification of attributes from Authentic Sources.
QTSPAS_01.searchText: qtspas_01 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources in accordance with technical specifications referred to in qtspas_07, member states shall define: - discovery mechanisms that enable qtsps to request information about authentic sources or designated intermediaries recognised at the national level. this includes information regarding the attributes of a natural or legal person for which the authentic source or designated intermediary is considered a primary source, or for which it is recognised as authentic in accordance with union law or national law, including administrative practices. - procedures for qtsps to request the verification of attributes from authentic sources.

QTSPAS_02.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_02.specification: An Authentic Source in the public sector, or its designated intermediary, SHALL implement an interface complying with the technical specification mentioned in QTSPAS_07 for receiving verification requests and sending responses. For each received request, the Authentic Source SHALL - identify and authenticate the requestor in such a way that it can subsequently determine whether the requestor is a QTSP issuing qualified electronic attestation of attributes, for example by means of a lookup in the QTSP Trusted List. - authenticate the User and obtain their approval, if it is legally obliged to do so, in addition to the User authentication and approval already performed by the QTSP according to QTSPAS_08. - verify whether the attribute values claimed by the QTSP match the values held by the Authentic Source
QTSPAS_02.notes: and, finally, - respond with one of the following for each attribute: +'match', if the attribute value held for this User by the Authentic Source is identical to the value claimed by the QTSP, + 'no match', if the attribute value held for this User by the Authentic Source is not identical to the value claimed by the QTSP, including if the Authentic Source is the authentic source for this attribute but does not hold a value for this User, +'unknown', if the Authentic Source is not the authentic source for this attribute.
QTSPAS_02.searchText: qtspas_02 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources an authentic source in the public sector, or its designated intermediary, shall implement an interface complying with the technical specification mentioned in qtspas_07 for receiving verification requests and sending responses. for each received request, the authentic source shall - identify and authenticate the requestor in such a way that it can subsequently determine whether the requestor is a qtsp issuing qualified electronic attestation of attributes, for example by means of a lookup in the qtsp trusted list. - authenticate the user and obtain their approval, if it is legally obliged to do so, in addition to the user authentication and approval already performed by the qtsp according to qtspas_08. - verify whether the attribute values claimed by the qtsp match the values held by the authentic source and, finally, - respond with one of the following for each attribute: +'match', if the attribute value held for this user by the authentic source is identical to the value claimed by the qtsp, + 'no match', if the attribute value held for this user by the authentic source is not identical to the value claimed by the qtsp, including if the authentic source is the authentic source for this attribute but does not hold a value for this user, +'unknown', if the authentic source is not the authentic source for this attribute.

QTSPAS_03.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_03.specification: An Authentic Source or designated intermediary SHALL respond to a verification request for attributes by any QTSP issuing qualified electronic attestation of attributes.
QTSPAS_03.searchText: qtspas_03 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources an authentic source or designated intermediary shall respond to a verification request for attributes by any qtsp issuing qualified electronic attestation of attributes.

QTSPAS_04.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_04.specification: An Authentic Source or designated intermediary SHALL implement the technical specifications mentioned in QTSPAS_01, so that the QTSP will receive the result of the verification of the requested attributes as described in QTSPAS_02. If the verification is deferred, the response to the QTSP SHALL include the maximum time that it will take to verify the requested attributes, and a unique identifier that the QTSP SHALL use to obtain the result of the verification.
QTSPAS_04.searchText: qtspas_04 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources an authentic source or designated intermediary shall implement the technical specifications mentioned in qtspas_01, so that the qtsp will receive the result of the verification of the requested attributes as described in qtspas_02. if the verification is deferred, the response to the qtsp shall include the maximum time that it will take to verify the requested attributes, and a unique identifier that the qtsp shall use to obtain the result of the verification.

QTSPAS_05.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_05.specification: A QTSP SHALL send an attribute verification request directly to the Authentic Source or designated intermediary recognised at national level, after discovering it using the mechanisms mentioned in QTSPAS_01.
QTSPAS_05.searchText: qtspas_05 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources a qtsp shall send an attribute verification request directly to the authentic source or designated intermediary recognised at national level, after discovering it using the mechanisms mentioned in qtspas_01.

QTSPAS_06.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_06.specification: Member States SHALL specify the processes and mechanisms to designate the Authentic Sources or intermediaries recognised at national level in accordance with Union or national law, allowing these Authentic Sources or intermediaries to verify the attributes presented to them by QTSPs.
QTSPAS_06.searchText: qtspas_06 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources member states shall specify the processes and mechanisms to designate the authentic sources or intermediaries recognised at national level in accordance with union or national law, allowing these authentic sources or intermediaries to verify the attributes presented to them by qtsps.

QTSPAS_07.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_07.specification: The Commission SHALL publish, in cooperation with the European Digital Identity Cooperation Group, a technical specification, referring to applicable standards, specifications and procedures, that will cover at least the attributes specified in Annex VI, wherever those attributes rely on Authentic Sources within the public sector, for which Member States must ensure that measures are taken to allow qualified providers of electronic attestations of attributes to verify by electronic means, at the request of the User, their authenticity against the relevant authentic source.
QTSPAS_07.searchText: qtspas_07 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources the commission shall publish, in cooperation with the european digital identity cooperation group, a technical specification, referring to applicable standards, specifications and procedures, that will cover at least the attributes specified in annex vi, wherever those attributes rely on authentic sources within the public sector, for which member states must ensure that measures are taken to allow qualified providers of electronic attestations of attributes to verify by electronic means, at the request of the user, their authenticity against the relevant authentic source.

QTSPAS_07a.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_07a.specification: The standards and procedures mentioned in QTSPAS_07 SHOULD, whenever possible, be aligned and compatible with those used for the platforms implementing the Once Only Technical System (OOTS).
QTSPAS_07a.notes: There is a clear synergy of both of these data exchange approaches. In fact, the national OOTS node would be a candidate for acting as an intermediary between QTSPs issuing QEAAs and the Authentic Sources.
QTSPAS_07a.searchText: qtspas_07a requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources the standards and procedures mentioned in qtspas_07 should, whenever possible, be aligned and compatible with those used for the platforms implementing the once only technical system (oots). there is a clear synergy of both of these data exchange approaches. in fact, the national oots node would be a candidate for acting as an intermediary between qtsps issuing qeaas and the authentic sources.

QTSPAS_08.topicTitle: Requirements for QTSPs to access Authentic Sources
QTSPAS_08.specification: A QTSP SHALL obtain approval from the User to verify the authenticity of the attributes, before requesting the verification of those attributes by the relevant Authentic Source or designated intermediary.
QTSPAS_08.searchText: qtspas_08 requirements for qtsps to access authentic sources a qtsp shall obtain approval from the user to verify the authenticity of the attributes, before requesting the verification of those attributes by the relevant authentic source or designated intermediary.

EDP_01.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL enable an Attestation Provider to optionally express an embedded disclosure policy for a QEAA, PuB-EAA, or non-qualified EAA.
EDP_01.notes: The [European Digital Identity Regulation] does not contain a requirement for PIDs to be able to contain an embedded disclosure policy.
EDP_01.searchText: edp_01 embedded disclosure policies a wallet unit shall enable an attestation provider to optionally express an embedded disclosure policy for a qeaa, pub-eaa, or non-qualified eaa. the [european digital identity regulation] does not contain a requirement for pids to be able to contain an embedded disclosure policy.

EDP_02.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support embedded disclosure policies implementing the 'Authorised relying parties only policy' described in Annex III of Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979. If present, such an embedded disclosure policy SHALL contain a list of EU-wide unique identifiers of Relying Parties, as specified in Reg_32. The Wallet Unit SHALL retrieve the Relying Party identifier from the access certificate presented by the Relying Party, and compare it to the list of authorised identifiers in the policy, unless the Relying Party is an intermediary. If the Relying Party is an intermediary, the Wallet Unit SHALL retrieve the unique identifier of the intermediated Relying Party from the presentation request or from the registration certificate of the intermediated Relying Party and compare this identifier to the list of authorised identifiers in the policy.
EDP_02.notes: See RPI_07 for how the Wallet Unit can see if the Relying Party is an intermediary.
EDP_02.searchText: edp_02 embedded disclosure policies a wallet unit shall support embedded disclosure policies implementing the 'authorised relying parties only policy' described in annex iii of implementing regulation (eu) 2024/2979. if present, such an embedded disclosure policy shall contain a list of eu-wide unique identifiers of relying parties, as specified in reg_32. the wallet unit shall retrieve the relying party identifier from the access certificate presented by the relying party, and compare it to the list of authorised identifiers in the policy, unless the relying party is an intermediary. if the relying party is an intermediary, the wallet unit shall retrieve the unique identifier of the intermediated relying party from the presentation request or from the registration certificate of the intermediated relying party and compare this identifier to the list of authorised identifiers in the policy. see rpi_07 for how the wallet unit can see if the relying party is an intermediary.

EDP_03.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support embedded disclosure policies implementing the 'Specific root of trust' policy described in Annex III of Implementing Regulation (EU) 2024/2979. If present, such an embedded disclosure policy SHALL contain a list of root or intermediate certificates used for signing Relying Party access certificates. The Wallet Unit SHALL compare the certificate chain that was used to sign the access certificate provided by the Relying Party to the list of authorised root or intermediate certificates in the policy, unless the Relying Party is an intermediary. If the Relying Party is an intermediary, the Wallet Unit SHALL retrieve the root certificate of the Provider of registration certificates of the intermediated Relying Party from the presentation request or from the Registrar's online service (as applicable) and compare this certificate to the list of authorised certificates in the policy.
EDP_03.notes: See RPI_07 for how the Wallet Unit can see if the Relying Party is an intermediary.
EDP_03.searchText: edp_03 embedded disclosure policies a wallet unit shall support embedded disclosure policies implementing the 'specific root of trust' policy described in annex iii of implementing regulation (eu) 2024/2979. if present, such an embedded disclosure policy shall contain a list of root or intermediate certificates used for signing relying party access certificates. the wallet unit shall compare the certificate chain that was used to sign the access certificate provided by the relying party to the list of authorised root or intermediate certificates in the policy, unless the relying party is an intermediary. if the relying party is an intermediary, the wallet unit shall retrieve the root certificate of the provider of registration certificates of the intermediated relying party from the presentation request or from the registrar's online service (as applicable) and compare this certificate to the list of authorised certificates in the policy. see rpi_07 for how the wallet unit can see if the relying party is an intermediary.

EDP_05.specification: An embedded disclosure policy SHOULD contain a link to a website of the Attestation Provider explaining the disclosure policy in layman's terms. If this is the case, the Wallet Unit SHALL display the link to the User and allow them to navigate to that website.
EDP_05.searchText: edp_05 embedded disclosure policies an embedded disclosure policy should contain a link to a website of the attestation provider explaining the disclosure policy in layman's terms. if this is the case, the wallet unit shall display the link to the user and allow them to navigate to that website.
