10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the OpenID4VCI protocol specified in [OpenID4VCI], as profiled by the 'OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance' profile specified in [HAIP], and with additions and changes as documented in this Annex (see e.g. this Topic and [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
10.searchText: issu_01 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the openid4vci protocol specified in [openid4vci], as profiled by the 'openid for verifiable credential issuance' profile specified in [haip], and with additions and changes as documented in this annex (see e.g. this topic and [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: PID Providers and Attestation Providers SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol specified in [OpenID4VCI], as profiled by the 'OpenID for Verifiable Credential Issuance' profile specified in [HAIP], and with additions and changes as documented in this Annex (see e.g. this Topic and [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
10.searchText: issu_01a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit pid providers and attestation providers shall support the openid4vci protocol specified in [openid4vci], as profiled by the 'openid for verifiable credential issuance' profile specified in [haip], and with additions and changes as documented in this annex (see e.g. this topic and [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]) and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Wallet Providers SHALL ensure that their Wallet Solution supports the attestation formats specified in ISO/IEC 18013-5, see [ISO18013-5], and in SD-JWT-based Verifiable Credentials (SD-JWT VC), see [SD-JWT-VC], with additions and changes as documented in this Annex and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the Commission.
10.searchText: issu_02 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet providers shall ensure that their wallet solution supports the attestation formats specified in iso/iec 18013-5, see [iso18013-5], and in sd-jwt-based verifiable credentials (sd-jwt vc), see [sd-jwt-vc], with additions and changes as documented in this annex and in future technical specifications created by or on behalf of the commission.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Wallet Units, PID Providers, and Attestation Providers SHALL support the [W3C Digital Credentials API]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for the issuance of PIDs and attestations, provided that a) this API is a W3C Recommendation, b) this API complies with the expectations outlined in [Chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3)  of the Topic F discussion paper, and c) this API is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.
10.searchText: issu_03 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit wallet units, pid providers, and attestation providers shall support the [w3c digital credentials api]](<https://wicg.github.io/digital-credentials/>) for the issuance of pids and attestations, provided that a) this api is a w3c recommendation, b) this api complies with the expectations outlined in [chapter 3](../../discussion-topics/f-digital-credential-api.md#3)  of the topic f discussion paper, and c) this api is broadly supported by relevant browsers and operating systems.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: The OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable PID Providers and Attestation Provider to issue to a Wallet Unit a batch of multiple PIDs or attestations that are simultaneously valid and contain the same attributes.
10.searchText: issu_04 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable pid providers and attestation provider to issue to a wallet unit a batch of multiple pids or attestations that are simultaneously valid and contain the same attributes.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL support a process to activate a newly issued PID, in accordance with the requirements for LoA High in [Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32015R1502) Section 2.2.2. The Wallet Unit SHALL NOT allow a User to use a non-activated PID.
10.notes: a) The goal of the activation process is to verify that the PID was delivered into the Wallet Unit and WSCA/WSCD of the User who is the subject of the PID. b) This requirement is not applicable for QEAAs, PuB-EAAs or non-qualified EAAs, since these are not identity means in the sense of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/1502.
10.searchText: issu_05 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall support a process to activate a newly issued pid, in accordance with the requirements for loa high in [commission implementing regulation (eu) 2015/1502](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=celex%3a32015r1502) section 2.2.2. the wallet unit shall not allow a user to use a non-activated pid. a) the goal of the activation process is to verify that the pid was delivered into the wallet unit and wsca/wscd of the user who is the subject of the pid. b) this requirement is not applicable for qeaas, pub-eaas or non-qualified eaas, since these are not identity means in the sense of commission implementing regulation (eu) 2015/1502.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PID or an attestation from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, it SHALL verify that the PID or attestation it received matches the PID or attestation requested by the Wallet Unit.
10.searchText: issu_06 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pid or an attestation from a pid provider or attestation provider, it shall verify that the pid or attestation it received matches the pid or attestation requested by the wallet unit.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PID from a PID Provider, it SHALL validate the signature of the PID using a trust anchor provided in a PID Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates), unless this would result in the validation of the PID signature being done by the same component that created the signature.
10.notes: This could be the case in architectures where the Wallet Provider is also the PID Provider and the Wallet Units use a remote HSM as their WSCD.
10.searchText: issu_07 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pid from a pid provider, it shall validate the signature of the pid using a trust anchor provided in a pid provider trusted list made available in accordance with [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)], unless this would result in the validation of the pid signature being done by the same component that created the signature. this could be the case in architectures where the wallet provider is also the pid provider and the wallet units use a remote hsm as their wscd.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a QEAA from a QEAA Provider, it SHALL validate the qualified signature of the QEAA in accordance with Art.32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For the verification, the Wallet Unit SHALL use a trust anchor provided in a QEAA Provider Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation].
10.searchText: issu_08 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a qeaa from a qeaa provider, it shall validate the qualified signature of the qeaa in accordance with art.32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for the verification, the wallet unit shall use a trust anchor provided in a qeaa provider trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a PuB-EAA from a PUB-EAA Provider, it SHALL validate the qualified signature of the PuB-EAA in accordance with Art. 32 of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. For that verification, the Wallet Unit SHALL use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the QTSP supporting the qualified signature. The Wallet Unit SHALL also validate the qualified certificate of the QTSP using a trust anchor provided in a Trusted List made available in accordance with [Art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2014.257.01.0073.01.ENG#d1e2162-73-1) of the [European Digital Identity Regulation]. Finally, the Wallet Unit SHALL also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [Article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32024R1183#d1e3902-1-1).
10.searchText: issu_09 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a pub-eaa from a pub-eaa provider, it shall validate the qualified signature of the pub-eaa in accordance with art. 32 of the [european digital identity regulation]. for that verification, the wallet unit shall use the public key provided in the qualified certificate of the qtsp supporting the qualified signature. the wallet unit shall also validate the qualified certificate of the qtsp using a trust anchor provided in a trusted list made available in accordance with [art. 22](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=uriserv%3aoj.l_.2014.257.01.0073.01.eng#d1e2162-73-1) of the [european digital identity regulation]. finally, the wallet unit shall also verify the certified attributes of the qualified certificate, as specified in [article 45f](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/all/?uri=celex:32024r1183#d1e3902-1-1).

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: After a Wallet Unit receives a non-qualified EAA from an EAA Provider, it SHALL validate the signature of the EAA using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable Rulebook, see [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
10.notes: a) Requirements ISSU_07 to ISSU_10 are equivalent to requirements OIA_12 to OIA_15 in [Topic 1](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a231-topic-1---accessing-online-services-with-a-wallet-unit). b) These requirements imply that a Wallet Instance must be aware whether the attestation it is requesting from an issuer is a PID, a QEAA, a PuB-EAA, or a non-qualified EAA. These requirements also imply that the Wallet Unit must store trust anchors in such a way that, when it receives an issued attestation, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for PIDs, for QEAAs, for PuB-EAAs, or for non-qualified EAAs. c) PID Providers, QEAA Providers, and PuB-EAA Providers are trusted by other actors in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or PIDs) that they are not legally allowed to issue. This trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. However, non-qualified EAA Providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. Therefore, before requesting an non-qualified attestation, a Wallet Unit may need to verify that the non-qualified EAA Provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation. Mechanisms allowing to do this may be defined in the applicable Rulebook, see ARB_26.
10.searchText: issu_10 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit after a wallet unit receives a non-qualified eaa from an eaa provider, it shall validate the signature of the eaa using a trust anchor provided according to the mechanism(s) specified in the applicable rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. a) requirements issu_07 to issu_10 are equivalent to requirements oia_12 to oia_15 in [topic 1](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a231-topic-1---accessing-online-services-with-a-wallet-unit). b) these requirements imply that a wallet instance must be aware whether the attestation it is requesting from an issuer is a pid, a qeaa, a pub-eaa, or a non-qualified eaa. these requirements also imply that the wallet unit must store trust anchors in such a way that, when it receives an issued attestation, it is able to distinguish between trust anchors usable either for pids, for qeaas, for pub-eaas, or for non-qualified eaas. c) pid providers, qeaa providers, and pub-eaa providers are trusted by other actors in the eudi wallet ecosystem to not fraudulently issue attestations (or pids) that they are not legally allowed to issue. this trust is warranted since these kinds of providers operate within a regulated framework and are regularly audited. however, non-qualified eaa providers are unregulated and may not be completely trustworthy. therefore, before requesting an non-qualified attestation, a wallet unit may need to verify that the non-qualified eaa provider is authorised or registered to issue this type of attestation. mechanisms allowing to do this may be defined in the applicable rulebook, see arb_26.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL request the User's approval before storing a PID or attestation obtained from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider. When requesting approval, the Wallet Instance SHALL display the contents of the PID or attestation to the User. The Wallet Instance SHALL also inform the User about the identity of the PID Provider or Attestation Provider, using the subject information in the PID Provider's or Attestation Provider's access certificate.
10.searchText: issu_11 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall request the user's approval before storing a pid or attestation obtained from a pid provider or attestation provider. when requesting approval, the wallet instance shall display the contents of the pid or attestation to the user. the wallet instance shall also inform the user about the identity of the pid provider or attestation provider, using the subject information in the pid provider's or attestation provider's access certificate.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: In case one or more of the verifications in ISSU_06 - ISSU_11 fail, the Wallet Unit SHALL immediately delete the PID or attestation it received. The Wallet Instance SHALL notify the User about the fact that issuance of the PID or attestation was not successful, including the reason for this failure.
10.searchText: issu_11b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit in case one or more of the verifications in issu_06 - issu_11 fail, the wallet unit shall immediately delete the pid or attestation it received. the wallet instance shall notify the user about the fact that issuance of the pid or attestation was not successful, including the reason for this failure.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider or Attestation Provider SHALL offer its PIDs or attestations in all formats required in the PID Rulebook or the applicable Attestation Rulebook, see [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).
10.notes: Examples include the mdoc format specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and the SD-JWT VC-format specified in [SD-JWT VC].
10.searchText: issu_12 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider or attestation provider shall offer its pids or attestations in all formats required in the pid rulebook or the applicable attestation rulebook, see [[topic 12](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks)]. examples include the mdoc format specified in [iso/iec 18013-5] and the sd-jwt vc-format specified in [sd-jwt vc].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that, when a User instructs their Wallet Unit to request a PID or attestation from a PID Provider or Attestation Provider, the Wallet Unit requests that PID or attestation in all formats offered by the PID Provider or Attestation Provider.
10.notes: Examples include the mdoc format specified in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and the SD-JWT VC-format specified in [SD-JWT VC].
10.searchText: issu_12a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that, when a user instructs their wallet unit to request a pid or attestation from a pid provider or attestation provider, the wallet unit requests that pid or attestation in all formats offered by the pid provider or attestation provider. examples include the mdoc format specified in [iso/iec 18013-5] and the sd-jwt vc-format specified in [sd-jwt vc].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: During issuance of a PID or a device-bound attestation, the WSCA/WSCD or a key store SHALL generate a new key pair for a new PID or attestation, on request of the PID Provider or Attestation Provider via the Wallet Instance.
10.notes: See also WUA_05. In case of synchronous issuing in a remote HSM architecture, re-use of an existing key pair for the new PID or attestation may be acceptable and it may not be necessary to generate a new key pair for each new PID or attestation.
10.searchText: issu_12b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit during issuance of a pid or a device-bound attestation, the wsca/wscd or a key store shall generate a new key pair for a new pid or attestation, on request of the pid provider or attestation provider via the wallet instance. see also wua_05. in case of synchronous issuing in a remote hsm architecture, re-use of an existing key pair for the new pid or attestation may be acceptable and it may not be necessary to generate a new key pair for each new pid or attestation.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: The expiration date of a PID SHALL be no later than the expiration date of the WUA presented as part of the PID issuance process.
10.notes: This requirement is an implication of WURevocation_18 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). If the PID would be valid for longer than the WUA, the PID Provider would not be able to use the revocation information in the WUA to verify the revocation status of the Wallet Unit.
10.searchText: issu_12c issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the expiration date of a pid shall be no later than the expiration date of the wua presented as part of the pid issuance process. this requirement is an implication of wurevocation_18 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). if the pid would be valid for longer than the wua, the pid provider would not be able to use the revocation information in the wua to verify the revocation status of the wallet unit.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: If an Attestation Provider supports revocation chaining for its attestations per WURevocation_19 in [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation), the expiration date of an attestation SHALL be no later than the expiration date of the WUA presented as part of the attestation issuance process.
10.notes: See note in ISSU_12c.
10.searchText: issu_12d issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if an attestation provider supports revocation chaining for its attestations per wurevocation_19 in [topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation), the expiration date of an attestation shall be no later than the expiration date of the wua presented as part of the attestation issuance process. see note in issu_12c.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL ensure that at least one PID Provider is willing to issue a PID complying with [PID Rulebook] to Users of the Wallet Units it provides.
10.searchText: issu_13 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall ensure that at least one pid provider is willing to issue a pid complying with [pid rulebook] to users of the wallet units it provides.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL ensure that all PIDs it issues to Wallet Units comply with the requirements specified in [PID Rulebook].
10.searchText: issu_14 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall ensure that all pids it issues to wallet units comply with the requirements specified in [pid rulebook].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01 for issuing PIDs.
10.searchText: issu_15 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall support the openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01 for issuing pids.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Empty
10.searchText: issu_16 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit empty

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL implement device binding for all PIDs it issues, meaning it SHALL ensure that a PID is cryptographically bound to the WSCA/WSCD included in the Wallet Unit, as specified in requirements WUA_11 - WUA_11b in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation).
10.notes: Device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT-VC].
10.searchText: issu_17 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall implement device binding for all pids it issues, meaning it shall ensure that a pid is cryptographically bound to the wsca/wscd included in the wallet unit, as specified in requirements wua_11 - wua_11b in [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)]. device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [iso/iec 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [sd-jwt-vc].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL verify the identity of the subject of the PID in compliance with Level of Assurance (LoA) High requirements.
10.notes: These requirements will be determined by the relevant eID scheme.
10.searchText: issu_18 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall verify the identity of the subject of the pid in compliance with level of assurance (loa) high requirements. these requirements will be determined by the relevant eid scheme.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL ensure that the attributes attested in the PID issued are valid for the identified PID subject at any point of time of PID validity.
10.searchText: issu_18a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall ensure that the attributes attested in the pid issued are valid for the identified pid subject at any point of time of pid validity.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: For the verification of a WUA, a PID Provider SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Wallet Provider Trusted List it needs.
10.notes: a) The Wallet Provider Trusted List is explained in [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates). b) It is not mandatory for a PID Provider to accept all Wallet Provider Trusted Lists, if there are multiple. This is because it is not mandatory for a PID Provider to accept all certified Wallet Solutions in the EUDI Wallet ecosystem. Each PID Provider will choose which Trusted Lists they need to subscribe to.
10.searchText: issu_19 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of a wua, a pid provider shall accept the trust anchors in the wallet provider trusted list it needs. a) the wallet provider trusted list is explained in [[topic 31](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates)]. b) it is not mandatory for a pid provider to accept all wallet provider trusted lists, if there are multiple. this is because it is not mandatory for a pid provider to accept all certified wallet solutions in the eudi wallet ecosystem. each pid provider will choose which trusted lists they need to subscribe to.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL support at least one Wallet Solution, meaning that it is willing and able to issue a PID to a Wallet Unit on request of the User.
10.searchText: issu_19a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall support at least one wallet solution, meaning that it is willing and able to issue a pid to a wallet unit on request of the user.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: To inform its potential PID subjects about the Wallet Solution(s) they can use for requesting a PID, a PID Provider SHALL publish a list of supported Wallet Solutions in such a way that it can be easily found, for example on the PID Provider's website.
10.searchText: issu_20 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit to inform its potential pid subjects about the wallet solution(s) they can use for requesting a pid, a pid provider shall publish a list of supported wallet solutions in such a way that it can be easily found, for example on the pid provider's website.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Before issuing a PID, a PID Provider SHALL verify that the Wallet Provider mentioned in the Wallet Unit's WUA is present in a Wallet Provider Trusted List. The PID Provider SHALL also authenticate and validate the WUA using the trust anchor(s) registered for the Wallet Provider in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. Moreover, it SHALL verify that the Wallet Units's WUA is not revoked.
10.notes: a) For the WUA, see [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation) and [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation). b) [CIR 2024/2977](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32024R2977), Article 3 (9), also allows another authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme notified at assurance level high. However, the ARF does not further specify such other authentication mechanisms, which means that in general they will not be interoperable.
10.searchText: issu_21 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before issuing a pid, a pid provider shall verify that the wallet provider mentioned in the wallet unit's wua is present in a wallet provider trusted list. the pid provider shall also authenticate and validate the wua using the trust anchor(s) registered for the wallet provider in the wallet provider trusted list. moreover, it shall verify that the wallet units's wua is not revoked. a) for the wua, see [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)] and [[topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation)]. b) [cir 2024/2977](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/en/txt/?uri=celex:32024r2977), article 3 (9), also allows another authentication mechanism in accordance with an electronic identity scheme notified at assurance level high. however, the arf does not further specify such other authentication mechanisms, which means that in general they will not be interoperable.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL include its PID Provider access certificate in its Issuer metadata used in the common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01.
10.searchText: issu_22 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall include its pid provider access certificate in its issuer metadata used in the common openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A PID Provider SHALL sign its metadata (as defined in OpenID4VCI) using the private key corresponding to its PID Provider access certificate.
10.searchText: issu_22a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a pid provider shall sign its metadata (as defined in openid4vci) using the private key corresponding to its pid provider access certificate.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: The common OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in requirement ISSU_01, or an EUDI Wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, SHALL enable a PID Provider or Attestation Provider to include its access certificate and registration certificate in its Issuer metadata, according to requirement ISSU_22 and RPRC_22, respectively.
10.searchText: issu_22b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the common openid4vci protocol referenced in requirement issu_01, or an eudi wallet-specific extension or profile thereof, shall enable a pid provider or attestation provider to include its access certificate and registration certificate in its issuer metadata, according to requirement issu_22 and rprc_22, respectively.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: For the verification of PID Provider access certificates, a Wallet Unit SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Trusted List(s) of Access Certificate Authorities it needs.
10.notes: a) Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists are explained in [Topic 27](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties). b) It is not mandatory for a Wallet Unit to accept all Access Certificate Authority Trusted Lists for PID Providers, if there are multiple. Wallet Providers will choose which of these Trusted Lists they need to subscribe to, for example depending on the Member State(s) they are operating in.
10.searchText: issu_23 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit for the verification of pid provider access certificates, a wallet unit shall accept the trust anchors in the trusted list(s) of access certificate authorities it needs. a) access certificate authority trusted lists are explained in [[topic 27](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2316-topic-27---registration-of-pid-providers-providers-of-qeaas-pub-eaas-and-non-qualified-eaas-and-relying-parties)]. b) it is not mandatory for a wallet unit to accept all access certificate authority trusted lists for pid providers, if there are multiple. wallet providers will choose which of these trusted lists they need to subscribe to, for example depending on the member state(s) they are operating in.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Provider SHALL support at least one PID Provider, meaning that its Wallet Units SHALL be capable of requesting the issuance of a PID from these PID Provider(s), and that the Wallet Provider has agreed with the PID Provider(s) that the PID Provider(s) will process such a request according to the agreed rules and procedures.
10.searchText: issu_23a issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet provider shall support at least one pid provider, meaning that its wallet units shall be capable of requesting the issuance of a pid from these pid provider(s), and that the wallet provider has agreed with the pid provider(s) that the pid provider(s) will process such a request according to the agreed rules and procedures.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Prior to or during installation of a Wallet Instance, the Wallet Provider SHALL notify the User about the PID Provider(s) that are supported by the Wallet Unit.
10.searchText: issu_23b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit prior to or during installation of a wallet instance, the wallet provider shall notify the user about the pid provider(s) that are supported by the wallet unit.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A Wallet Unit SHALL authenticate and validate the PID Provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of a PID. The Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a CA that is in a Access Certificate Authority Trusted List.
10.searchText: issu_24 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a wallet unit shall authenticate and validate the pid provider access certificate before requesting the issuance of a pid. the wallet unit shall verify that the access certificate is authentic and is valid at the time of validation, and that the issuer of the access certificate is a ca that is in a access certificate authority trusted list.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Before requesting the issuance of a PID, the Wallet Unit SHALL verify that the PID Provider is indeed a registered PID Provider. The Wallet Unit SHALL do so using information contained in the PID Provider registration certificate, if available in the Credential Issuer metadata of the PID Provider. If the registration certificate is not available, the Wallet Unit SHALL use the URL of the Registrar's online service, contained in the Credential Issuer metadata, to obtain the necessary information from the Registrar. If the registered information does not confirm that the PID Provider is indeed registered as a PID Provider, the Wallet Unit SHALL display a warning to the User, and SHALL NOT request the issuance of a PID.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL ensure all attestations issued to Wallet Units comply with the requirements specified in the applicable Rulebook, as described in [Topic 12](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a239-topic-12---attestation-rulebooks).

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: An Attestation Provider SHALL support the OpenID4VCI protocol referenced in ISSU_01 for issuing attestations.
10.searchText: issu_26 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit an attestation provider shall support the openid4vci protocol referenced in issu_01 for issuing attestations.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: An Attestation Provider SHOULD implement device binding for all attestations it issues. If an issued attestation is device-bound, the Attestation Provider SHALL ensure that the attestation is cryptographically bound to a WSCA/WSCD or a keystore available to the Wallet Unit, as specified in requirement WUA_11 - WUA_11b in [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation).
10.notes: a) Device binding is called 'mdoc authentication' in [ISO/IEC 18013-5] and 'key binding' in [SD-JWT-VC]. b) Implementing mdoc authentication is mandatory in [ISO/IEC 18013-5]

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: If the subject of the attestation is a natural person, an Attestation Provider SHALL verify the identity of the subject of the attestation, in compliance with applicable requirements and in accordance with relevant standards or Implementing Regulations.
10.notes: Not every attestation has a natural person as its subject. For example, a holiday voucher may be valid for any User that can present it to a Relying Party and therefore has no subject. This is comparable to the concept of a 'bearer token'.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: If applicable, an Attestation Provider SHALL ensure that the attributes attested in the attestation issued are valid for the identified attestation subject.
10.searchText: issu_27b issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit if applicable, an attestation provider shall ensure that the attributes attested in the attestation issued are valid for the identified attestation subject.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: The Attestation Provider SHALL verify that the User requesting the attestation has the right to receive it.
10.searchText: issu_27c issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit the attestation provider shall verify that the user requesting the attestation has the right to receive it.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: For the verification of a WUA, an Attestation Provider SHALL accept the trust anchors in the Wallet Provider Trusted List.
10.notes: The Wallet Provider Trusted List is explained in [Topic 31](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2320-topic-31---notification-and-publication-of-pid-provider-wallet-provider-attestation-provider-access-certificate-authority-and-provider-of-registration-certificates).

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: A QEAA Provider or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL support all Wallet Solutions, except in case the attestation in question is a Strong User Authentication (SUA) attestation as meant in [Topic 20](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the Wallet Provider does not support processing of the transactional data associated with the SUA attestation. Except for such cases, A QEAA Provider or PuB-EAA Provider SHALL NOT discriminate between Wallet Solutions when processing a request for the issuance of an attestation.
10.notes: This requirement is not applicable for non-qualified EAA Providers. For example, a non-qualified EAA Provider may choose to issue attestations in the format specified in [W3C VCDM], see ARB_01a. In that case, it will support only those Wallet Solutions that have implemented this attestation format.
10.searchText: issu_29 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit a qeaa provider or pub-eaa provider shall support all wallet solutions, except in case the attestation in question is a strong user authentication (sua) attestation as meant in [topic 20](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2313-topic-20---strong-user-authentication-for-electronic-payments) and the wallet provider does not support processing of the transactional data associated with the sua attestation. except for such cases, a qeaa provider or pub-eaa provider shall not discriminate between wallet solutions when processing a request for the issuance of an attestation. this requirement is not applicable for non-qualified eaa providers. for example, a non-qualified eaa provider may choose to issue attestations in the format specified in [w3c vcdm], see arb_01a. in that case, it will support only those wallet solutions that have implemented this attestation format.

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Before issuing an attestation, an Attestation Provider SHALL: - verify that the Wallet Provider mentioned in the Wallet Unit's WUA is present in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. - authenticate and validate the WUA using the trust anchor(s) registered for the Wallet Provider in the Wallet Provider Trusted List. - verify that the Wallet Unit's WUA is not revoked.
10.notes: For the WUA, see [Topic 9](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation) and [Topic 38](https://github.com/eu-digital-identity-wallet/eudi-doc-architecture-and-reference-framework/blob/main/docs/annexes/annex-2/annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation).
10.searchText: issu_30 issuing a pid or attestation to a wallet unit before issuing an attestation, an attestation provider shall: - verify that the wallet provider mentioned in the wallet unit's wua is present in the wallet provider trusted list. - authenticate and validate the wua using the trust anchor(s) registered for the wallet provider in the wallet provider trusted list. - verify that the wallet unit's wua is not revoked. for the wua, see [[topic 9](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a236-topic-9---wallet-unit-attestation)] and [[topic 38](./annex-2.02-high-level-requirements-by-topic.md#a2322-topic-38---wallet-unit-revocation)].

10.topicTitle: Issuing a PID or attestation to a Wallet Unit
10.specification: Empty
